title: Business Analyst
job_description: Our Company: PharmaCord is a leading provider in pharmaceutical patient support services. Our services are sponsored by our pharmaceutical company clients. Together, we are committed to compassionately providing patients with support services during their journey on therapy.We deliver our services through our talented team of benefit specialists, nurses, pharmacists, case managers, pharmacy techs, program managers, and other incredibly talented team members who are supported by world-class proprietary technology systems developed internally by our team of engineers, system architects, coding professionals and data scientists.We are PharmaCord, a purpose-driven organization on a rapid growth journey.Our Team: Our team is highly motivated and passionate about providing the highest quality customer support to our patients. We look for individuals interested in growing with our company and working in an exciting, open and collegial work environment. We seek problem solvers who are compassionate, have high integrity and demonstrate grit. Our colleagues are enthusiastic team members who love what they do and are passionate about making a difference through their work. We take initiative, exhibit pride in our accomplishments, and are trusted to work independently while collaborating to share ideas, support, and resources.The Business Analyst is responsible for driving projects, enhancements, and requests to completion per the project scope, budget, requirements, project plan timeline, and quality parameters. The Business Analyst role is a results-oriented role that requires someone who is detail-oriented, analytical, takes initiative and can successfully multi-task. They must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and making decisions as appropriate. Projects will involve interacting with clients, third-party vendors, IT developers, IT quality analysts, leadership, shared services, and operations personnel.The Business Analyst responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:Responsible for creating, maintaining, and driving change requests and project plans for client deliveries within established timelines.Responsible for tracking client-requested enhancements and prioritizing them by working with IT leadership and business users.Provides technical and analytical support for multiple projects simultaneously.Establishes timeline, and coordinates with internal and external resources.A successful candidate will accomplish the following:Ensure proper communication about project status to all stakeholders.Drive to outcomes via detailed follow-ups and meetings.Escalate issues in a timely manner.Create a work product that is compliant with the business standards with a high level of detail and accuracy.Ensure the completion of projects within scope, on schedule, and on budget.Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for key systems and processes within the PharmaCord technology team.Collaborate with cross functional teams to understand organizational and operational challenges.Manage technical difficulties, working with developers when necessary.Identify opportunities for process improvement and/or standardization.Create, organize, and update documentation of newer versions and updates of the application(s) as necessary.Partner with project managers and senior leadership of the business community to identify and prioritize opportunities for utilizing IT to achieve the goals of the enterprise.Work with a strong sense of urgency.Be prepared to work in a high-growth fast-paced company.Perform other duties as assigned.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred or equivalent experience required.Technically savvy with excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills.Professional, effective, and clear communication skills (written and oral).Ability to effectively communicate with all types of stakeholders, including external clients.Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Word.At least 2 years of experience in the Information Technology department, healthcare experience preferred.At least 2 years of experience as a business analyst eliciting and documenting requirements.Experience creating and maintaining screen mocks.Experience working with internal and external clients to define business and technical needs.Experience eliciting and diagramming process flows.Experience working with Project Tracking Software preferred.A good understanding of SDLC process (Waterfall, Agile) is preferred.Although very minimal, flexibility to travel as needed is preferred.We are located in the River Ridge Commerce Center at 150 Hilton Drive, Jeffersonville, IN. You must be willing to work in this location; PharmaCord does reimburse for tolls if applicable, at the frequent user rate.Work Schedule & Environment:This is a full-time exempt position.The standard schedule for this role is 8:30am - 5:30pm, Monday - Friday. Some evenings and weekends may be required to support and attend events or other PharmaCord activities outside of these hours.Must be willing to travel to our other Jeffersonville and Louisville locations as needed.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. Light to moderate lifting may be required.This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, etc.Ability to travel as needed.Once you land this position, you’ll get to enjoy:  Our Benefits & PerksCompany paid Short-term Disability (STD)Increased competitive 401(k) company match up to 4%Affordable Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits - PharmaCord covers 75% of Medical Premiums for our employeesPharmaCord has not increased healthcare premiums in the past 4 yearsNEW! Concierge Medical Clinic free of cost for those enrolled in a PharmaCord medical plan (including dependents)Wellness discounts of up to $260 per year for participation in wellness programAnnual HSA employer contributionCompany paid and voluntary Life Insurance optionsVoluntary Life, AD&D and Long-Term Disability InsurancesPaid Parental Leave of AbsenceWellness and Employee Assistance ProgramsPTO benefits, flex days and paid holidaysEmployee Referral ProgramAmbassador ProgramTuition reimbursement program up to $5,000 per yearCompetitive Compensation & Flexible WorkingCompetitive starting pay ratesYearly merit increasesToll reimbursement program (valued at $655.20 per year)A Career You'll LoveWorking for PharmaCord - voted Best Places to Work in Kentucky for 2019 and 2021Work for a company that values diversity and makes deliberate efforts to create in inclusive workplaceOpportunities for advancement with a company that supports personal and professional growth.A challenging, stimulating work environment that encourages new ideasExposure to many learning and development opportunitiesPlaying a crucial part in the lives of our patients, physicians, and pharmacies by enhancing the patient services experienceOur new state of the art Headquarters building offering many amenities including collaborations spaces, outdoor dining, walking path, marketplace café, and more!Any offer of employment is contingent on completion of a background check to company standard. title: Automation BA

title: Business Analyst, Corporate Insights
job_description: Knauf Insulation North America is the world's fastest-growing insulation manufacturer. We are wholly committed to the conservation of the environment while also sustainably developing and manufacturing a comprehensive line of acoustical fiberglass insulation for residential, commercial, industrial, marine, OEM and metal building applications, using post-consumer recycled materials.We welcome passionate and creative individuals who thrive in an entrepreneurial, collaborative and ever-changing environment.We know how important your health, wellbeing, and financial strength is to you. To support you, we provide affordable benefits for you and your family members."Supporting all aspects of the individual — self, health, wealth and community”Our benefits include: Offsite Free Clinic  Medical, Dental, Vision – starting on day one!  Virtual Medical Services  401(k) Retirement Plan (earn 100% matching on your first 6% and fully vested day one)  Paid parental leave  Company paid life insurance  Vacation time  Tuition Reimbursement  Employee Assistance Program (EAP)  Plus, more! Growth opportunities available!Apply online or contact us to hear why our employees appreciate being part of the Knauf family!Summary of Position: In this role you will perform definition, data gathering and analysis of business situations, problems or opportunities in order to recommend a course of action. Analyze data streams for insights to assist in data driven decision making and visualize these insights through easily consumable dashboards or other visualization tools. Research, gather, and analyze market data in support of acquisition / investment projects. Prepare data rich presentations for management.Responsibilities Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover patterns, trends, and insights which support data driven business decision making. Use evidence-based problem identification and problem solving to support informed decision making. Advanced knowledge of MS Office, Tableau, SQL, MS SQL Server and other tools to analyze, and champion data visualization and dashboarding. Experience with common machine learning methods for descriptive and predictive applications Responsible for delivering cross-functional reporting, data exploratory analysis and hands-on development of highly visible visualization projects that create strategic and transformational value for key stakeholders. Deep statistical foundation and knowledge of statistical learning theory quantitative/statistical hypothesis analysis, and decision analytics. Translate data results into dashboards, written reports, tables, graphs and charts to convey information to management in a digestible and visually appealing format. Create written communication materials that effectively summarize findings and support recommendations. Leverage data to gain key insight into business opportunities, and effectively presents these insights to business stakeholders. Perform new market and acquisition target analysis in support of growth ambition. Proactively create documentary artifacts like business cases, usage scenarios, solution blueprints, FAQs, meeting notes… etc. Advanced knowledge of common software to build dashboards. Automate reporting for weekly business metrics, identify areas of opportunity to automate and scale ad-hoc analyses.Qualifications Education:  Bachelor's Degree in business, mathematics, computer science, or analytical techniques, advance degree preferred. Equivalent work experience.It is the policy of Knauf Insulation to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic prohibited by applicable law.

title: Business Analyst
job_description: The Purpose of the Business Analyst is to work closely with the Product Manager, Quality Assurance, Software Architects, and Development teams to produce quality software that meets our client needs. The Business Analyst will manage the requirements process and will serve as the liaison between the Product Manager and the Technology teams. You will be responsible to identify, assess, and document business requirements, recommending business priorities, and advising business on options, risks, and costs. Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible. Analyze impact of proposed solution across the business, develop use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to team, and contribute a business or process perspective during design reviews. Assist quality assurance team to ensure that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and ensure that the proper testing plans have been completed. Facilitate implementation of new functionality through training sessions, demos, and the development of appropriate documentation. Provide relevant test scenarios for the quality assurance team. Work with quality assurance team to develop system integration test scripts and ensure the testing results correspond to the business expectations.Essential FunctionsLead functional design portion of SDLC process including: Leading functional design meetings, writing design documents, coordinating the review process. Act as Liaison between business and technology teams in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements, Constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications; use cases and scenarios Hold responsibility for troubleshooting and filtering product development issues including bugs, configuration and documentation discrepancies. Maintain communication channels with clients during collaborative development efforts. Review feature "Ideas" from internal and external sources then escalate those features internally, for future development. Work across product teams to develop features and solutions to increase efficiency and productivity for our financial institution clients Work closely across departments & with customers to build system features that impact daily financial institution operations. Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications. Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures. Provide support to clients as necessary Provide support to internal teams as necessary Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies. Review Production Documentation for accuracy Review test cases for accuracy Communicate with other departments to coordinate test and deployment activities RequirementsBA or BS Business, Management, Computer Science, or other related degrees 3+ years Experience Business Analyst Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Knowledge of Bank commercial loan systems Ability to assimilate, organize and summarize large amounts of information Strong knowledge of Business Analysis techniques and processes Strong negotiation skills with ability to find successful resolutions to complex issues Proactive with a strong sense of accountability Ability to work both independently and as part of a close team depending upon project Highly motivated and self-directed Strong analytical skills and writing skills, to include solid experience in writing functional and technical specifications Proven ability to work closely with the business and translate business needs into functional specifications for technology. Excellent problem solving skills Advanced skill level in SDLC processes using both waterfall & agile methodologies. Strong ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize work efforts in a demanding high paced environment. Join our talented team at Baker Hill and make a significant impact on the financial technology industry. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and a supportive work environment that fosters professional growth and development. Apply now to be considered for this exciting opportunity!

title: D365 Business Analyst
job_description: Summary/Objective:A Business Analyst is a person who uses analysis and design techniques to solve business problems. In this role, the BSA will document current state “as-is” processes and drive consensus towards a desired “to-be” state. Also, the BSA must translate business requirements through analysis and design into complex functional solutions. The BSA plays a leadership role in the planning/analysis, design, and testing phases of D365 ERP projects, working closely with business stakeholders and the entire project team to ensure project success. title: Product Analyst
job_description: At Aline, we are committed to revolutionizing the senior living management technology market by continuously elevating our offerings and ensuring exceptional user experiences. In line with this commitment, we are seeking a dedicated Product Analyst to join our vibrant team. This role is designed for a dynamic individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about making a tangible impact through our products and services. The Product Analyst is crucial in driving our product development and project management efforts, offering extensive support across the entire product lifecycle. From requirements gathering to implementation and beyond, this role demands a blend of technical acumen, customer-centric focus, and innovative thinking. Join us in our mission to enhance the lives of seniors and their caregivers by delivering cutting-edge solutions and fostering meaningful engagements.The Product Analyst plays a pivotal role within the organization by offering comprehensive product and project support, facilitating client coordination, and providing invaluable subject matter expertise. Engaged throughout the entire product life cycle, this individual contributes to key phases including requirements gathering, testing, implementation, and ongoing support.ResponsibilitiesGather and analyze user requirements, business needs, and technical specifications to understand the scope and objectives of software products.Collaborate with stakeholders to define product features, functionalities, and priorities.Conduct market research to identify trends, competitive landscape, and user preferences.Work closely with UX designers to create intuitive and user-friendly software interfaces.Document detailed functional requirements, use cases, and user stories.Partner with stakeholder groups to understand business needs and identify new solutions for improving business processes.Prepare user manuals, release notes, and other documentation to support product deployment and usage.Perform application troubleshooting and problem-solving.Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as user adoption, utilization of new features, and revenue-driven metrics.Evaluate feedback from users, stakeholders, and internal teams to identify areas for product enhancement.Complete user acceptance and stress testing on new product features & functionality.Support the Implementation Team with new customer onboarding.May perform other duties as needed and/or assigned. RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field. Equivalent experience will be considered.Minimum of three (3) years of experience as a Product Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, preferably within a software development or technology-driven environment.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other relevant productivity tools.Exceptional customer service skills with a focus on understanding and addressing user needs.Strong analytical abilities with the capability to prioritize tasks, plan effectively, and solve complex problems.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Demonstrated time management and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and adapt to changing priorities in a dynamic environment.Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while also functioning well within a team environment.Familiarity with SQL Server Management Studio or other database management tools is a plus.Experience working in Agile methodologies, including Scrum or Kanban.Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO®) is a plus.Experience working with JIRA is a plus.Apply Now

title: Business Analyst
job_description: In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for client data ingestion, ensuring seamless integration of external client data to enhance our analytics capabilities and provide valuable insights to our stakeholders. Join us in our data-driven journey.About The RoleAs a Business Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into actionable insights and innovative products. With a keen eye for detail and passion for problem solving, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the company's data strategy and driving business successIn This Role, Your Key Business Responsibilities Will IncludeIdentify data product opportunities, including new products and product enhancements, through design thinking sessions and stakeholder engagementCollaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, such as Technical Accounting, Experience Studies, Valuation, and Inforce Optimization, to gather and document product requirementsTranslate product requirements into clear and actionable user stories or product specificationsDevelop and implement tactical data products using available tools and support user onboardingDevelop and maintain key metrics to measure product successUnderstand L&H Re systems and processes to advise and assist IT in system enhancements and migrating tactical products into strategic onesDesign, map, and code complex and unique client data setupsAbout The TeamThe Data Management & Insights [DMI] team is part of Business Excellence delivering on the promise of a stable end-to-end operating platform for Life & Health Reinsurance [L&H Re]. Their mission is to make client data accessible to stakeholders by systematically acquiring and ingesting it. The team utilizes advanced analytics techniques to generate valuable insights for L&H Re. With a continuous improvement mindset, they strive to enhance data, systems, and processes for both their own use and their stakeholders.About YouYou have proven strategic, analytical, and conceptual thinking abilities. You have effective communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to stakeholders clearly and concisely.Essential SkillsBachelor of Science degree with 5+ years of relevant experienceProficient in data mapping, ETL processing, and data integrationStrong understanding of data structures and testing methodologies for onboarding large and complex client datasetsProficient in SQL, Python/R codingNice To HaveGood understanding of relational databases, such as Oracle and SQL ServerExperience in handling large volumes of structured and unstructured dataFamiliarity with best practices of data management and governanceExperience working in Waterfall and Agile projects, while leading projects being a plusHands-on experience with Data Integration tools (e.g. Palantir) and techniques (e.g. EDA, predictive & prescriptive analysis), and visualization software such as Power BIThe position will be located in our Fort Wayne, IN office. Our company has a hybrid work model where the expectation is that you will be in the office two to three days per week on average.This role will be unable to offer any assistance with relocation or visa sponsorship.About Swiss ReSwiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.Swiss Re is an equal opportunity employer. It is our practice to recruit, hire and promote without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, pregnancy, sexual orientations, marital status, military status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Decisions on employment are solely based on an individual's qualifications for the position being filled.During the recruitment process, reasonable accommodations for disabilities are available upon request. If contacted for an interview, please inform the Recruiter/HR Professional of the accommodation needed.KeywordsReference Code: 129261

title: Business Analyst CDM- Remote Option
job_description: BenefitsJoin Our Team We are looking for compassionate, caring, and dedicated Business Analyst CDM to join our team and help us continue our tradition of excellence. Benefits We pride ourselves in retaining our top talent by offering work environments that support professional development and personal success. In addition to our robust healthcare and retirement plans, we offer: Onsite children’s care centers (Infant through Pre-K)  Tuition reimbursement and generous PTO accrual  Free access to fitness centers with wellness education  401k with matching contributions  Career advancement opportunities  ompetitive pay, shift and weekend incentives, yearly opportunities for pay increases and bonuses As a Business Analyst CDM, you will play a critical role in continuing the healing mission of Deaconess. Job Overview This centralized position is responsible for assisting in the maintenance of the Charge Description Masters for all Deaconess Epic facilities. This includes responsibility for charge capture initiatives, price setting, operational reviews, and working to ensure linkage between operations, billing, HIM and other areas are fully integrated and functional. Additional responsibilities include attending and supporting the DHS Revenue Cycle team and assisting with additional projects as assigned. Assist in maintenance of Charge Master and Epic Procedure (EAP) Master Files accordance with government and commercial payers for accurate and compliance charging and to meet billing requirements; adding, deleting, activating, reactivating Epic charge codes.  Ensure Epic and ancillary system charge master files are in sync.  Stays current with government and commercial payer rules and regulations and applies changes to charge code set up.  Participate in DHS revenue cycle committees and related work groups.  May prepare and deliver training and education materials related to accurate charging and billing.  May prepare agendas and supporting materials for charge master related meetings.  Works with Finance, Health Information Management, Revenue Cycle Liaisons and/or Information Services departments to identify critical charge related issues and resolve them in an expedient and proactive manner.  Ability to provide valuable input for revenue cycle process improvement initiatives.  Knowledge of ICD-10-CM, CPT/HCPCs procedure coding, UB-04 and 1500 billing requirements. What you will need Bachelor’s degree in healthcare-related field preferred.  2-3 years’ experience conducting charge description master set up and maintenance OR an approved equivalent combination of education and experience.  Epic charge master application experience preferred.  2-3 years of coding experience in a hospital inpatient and outpatient setting is a plus.  Registered Health Information Technician (RHIT) or Registered Health Information Administrator (RHIA) and/or Clinical Coding Specialist (CCS), and/or Certified Professional Coder (CPC) credentials preferred. PI239820226

title: Business Senior Analyst
job_description: At Zimmer Biomet, we believe in pushing the boundaries of innovation and driving our mission forward. As a global medical technology leader for nearly 100 years, a patient’s mobility is enhanced by a Zimmer Biomet product or technology every 8 seconds.As a Zimmer Biomet team member, you will share in our commitment to providing mobility and renewed life to people around the world. To support our talent team, we focus on development opportunities, robust employee resource groups (ERGs), a flexible working environment, location specific competitive total rewards, wellness incentives and a culture of recognition and performance awards. We are committed to creating an environment where every team member feels included, respected, empowered, and recognized.What You Can ExpectThe Business Sr. Analyst serves as a contributor and business lead in the initiation, requirements gathering, design, prototyping, development, testing and administration of current and future analytical solutions, regarding CRM and Sales Force Effectiveness analytical needs. This position works in close coordination with applicable Finance, Marketing, Business Unit and IT team members in various capacities.How You'll Create Impact Serve as a Subject Matter Expert and Champion in driving industry and process best practices in the evolution of the company’s analytic suites (Tableau and Alteryx). Technical and non-technical maintenance of analytical solutions such as dashboards, workflows, reports or other products. Administer, manage and implement user security, user set up and user licensing on Tableau and Alteryx servers. Work with management and end-users to create and manage data visualizations and automated reports. Lead and assist with the creation and execution of functional test scripts and risk/Issue identification & mitigation approaches. Lead and assist with mass uploads and updates of data as required: removing unnecessary fields and data; ensuring screens, fields and workflow have accurate names and reflect current workflow. Partner with Marketing on field implementation of targeted analytics. Align with Executive Sales Leadership on planning and execution of tactics and long term strategies. Provide recommendations and assist in the creation and implementation of the Strategic Roadmap. Conduct research, analysis, and participate in strategy sessions for short-term and long-term business goals. Maintain high level familiarity with other business application capabilities and scope definitions in order to make recommendations about potential integrations. Work effectively with technical staff, business operations and subject matter experts, project managers, trainers, executives and implementation providers to create and deliver dynamic and fully functioning instructional solutions. Determine new requirements from user feedback to be fed back to the technical support team. Conduct requirements and solution design workshops. Responsible for front line support of field users where the user needs training and coaching on existing functionality. Resolve issues directly where possible and escalate to IT and Finance where necessary.What Makes You Stand Out Must have experience assisting or taking direct responsibility for developing and implementing complex analytical solutions in a highly collaborative and rapid deployment timeline Good data architecture, data visualization and reporting skill set Strong Tableau security knowledge (via groups, permissions and row level security) Good understanding of data architecture and ability of connecting various data sets into one Proven track record of working in close collaboration with IT, Finance and business stakeholders on both large and small technology/change initiatives Good project management and collaboration skills with the ability to contribute on and lead a cross-functional team and build relationships with multiple stakeholders, both internally and externally with users ranging from executive to line level Strong communication skills in facilitation, listening, writing, and questioning Strong problem solving skills and mindset A passion for helping others to learn Excellent verbal and written skills Excellent organizational skills, time management and attention to detail Ability to work independently with minimal supervision Customer-centric attitudeYour Background Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent experience Tableau Desktop knowledge/certification preferred Excel VBA and SQL coding knowledge preferred Minimum of three (3) years of experience assisting or taking direct responsibility for developing and implementing analytical initiatives MBA or graduate degree preferred Previous experience working in healthcare preferredTravel ExpectationsTypically minimal, but up to 10% when deployment projects call for itEOE/M/F/Vet/Disability1648

title: Business Analyst III
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  Job DescriptionAs an IT Operations Business Partner, you will ensure effective IT operations that supports the rapid growth at the Fishers site. You should have expertise in implementing and supporting both applications and IT infrastructure. You will partner closely with the laboratory team and multi-functional support teams at the site on tier meetings, projects, initiatives, process improvements, important metrics, and critical issues. You will work closely with our Global IT team and partners on carrying out the IT demand received from the site. You will develop a prioritized roadmap and meaningful IT metrics for the site.What will you do? Participates and acts as the voice of IT in multi-functional site operations meetings. Coordinates business demand with internal IT teams and partners. Develops an IT roadmap of site projects and initiatives. Develops IT metrics and continuously works to improve. Efficiently handles IT issues and requests to SLA targets. Regularly coordinates with internal customers on IT solutions. Participates in IT projects up to and including leading projects. Handles business priorities and partner concerns. Advocates for high quality change processes. Exhibits high integrity and promotes high standards of delivery. Fosters positive work environment and teamwork. Frequently communicates global and corporate IT standards and changes. Other tasks/duties including remotely supporting regional sites may be assigned.How you will get here?Education HS degree required. Degree in Information Systems or Computer Science or related degree is preferred -OR- eight years of relevant experience.Experience 5+ years working in IT operations or as an IT Business Analyst, or equivalent role. 3+ years working with internal multi-functional teams on IT initiatives. 5+ years installing, developing, or supporting software applications. 5+ years implementing or supporting IT infrastructure.Preferred Experience Experience using ServiceNow or other ITIL applications. Experience working in Life Sciences, Biotech, Pharma, or Manufacturing. Experience supporting or knowledge of SAP or other ERP systems. Experience supporting or knowledge of manufacturing execution systems and/or warehouse management systems. Experience using PowerBI, Tableau, or other reporting tools. Experience with MS SQL Experience working with PowerAutomate, UiPath, or other automations tools. ITIL experience or certification. Project management experience or PMP certification. Lean Six Sigma experience or certification.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Outstanding multi-functional business facing skills. Outstanding ability to solve problems and handle critical issues effectively. Outstanding ability to collect, assess, and communicate business requirements. Outstanding ability to take ownership and work with speed and accuracy. Solid ability to prioritize, work independently, and drive effective change. Strong written and verbal skills and consistent track record to influence others. Strong data analysis, communication, and presentation skills. Good ability to work within a matrixed environment. Ability to engage patiently with partners and communicate changes. Ability to identify technical issues related to IT infrastructure and applications. Knowledge of common cyber security threats and preventative measures. Knowledge of SCRUM, Agile, and Waterfall methodologies. Proficient using Microsoft Suite.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Goshen Physicians
job_description: This position is 80% remote and must live within a 90-minute radius of Goshen, IN.The Senior Financial Analyst role within the Decision Support Department at Goshen Health is a pivotal position focused on providing financial expertise and analysis to support Goshen Physicians. This role primarily involves conducting in-depth analysis of provider compensation, including modeling and fair market value assessment. Additionally, the position encompasses tasks such as building proformas, program performance reporting, budget planning, variance analysis, dashboarding, and goal/KPI tracking. The Senior Financial Analyst will play a key role in ensuring the financial health and success of Goshen Physicians by providing valuable insights and recommendations based on comprehensive financial analysis.Position QualificationsMinimum Education: Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration/ManagementPreferred Education: CPA certification or a Master’s Degree in Business, Accounting, or Healthcare AdministrationMinimum Experience: 5 or more years of analytical work, team leading and project management experience required. Knowledge of spreadsheet and word processing requiredPreferred Experience: 5 or more years of budgeting, cost accounting and health care reimbursement experiencePreferred Certifications: CHFP (HFMA); CSMC (HFMA)PI239421555

title: Business Analyst, Corporate Insights
job_description: Knauf Insulation North America is the world's fastest-growing insulation manufacturer. We are wholly committed to the conservation of the environment while also sustainably developing and manufacturing a comprehensive line of acoustical fiberglass insulation for residential, commercial, industrial, marine, OEM and metal building applications, using post-consumer recycled materials.We welcome passionate and creative individuals who thrive in an entrepreneurial, collaborative and ever-changing environment.We know how important your health, wellbeing, and financial strength is to you. To support you, we provide affordable benefits for you and your family members."Supporting all aspects of the individual — self, health, wealth and community”Our benefits includeOffsite Free ClinicMedical, Dental, Vision – starting on day one!Virtual Medical Services401(k) Retirement Plan (earn 100% matching on your first 6% and fully vested day one)Paid parental leaveCompany paid life insuranceVacation time Tuition ReimbursementEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Plus, more!Growth opportunities available!Apply online or contact us to hear why our employees appreciate being part of the Knauf family!Summary of Position In this role you will perform definition, data gathering and analysis of business situations, problems or opportunities in order to recommend a course of action. Analyze data streams for insights to assist in data driven decision making and visualize these insights through easily consumable dashboards or other visualization tools. Research, gather, and analyze market data in support of acquisition / investment projects. Prepare data rich presentations for management. Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover patterns, trends, and insights which support data driven business decision making. Use evidence-based problem identification and problem solving to support informed decision making. Advanced knowledge of MS Office, Tableau, SQL, MS SQL Server and other tools to analyze, and champion data visualization and dashboarding. Experience with common machine learning methods for descriptive and predictive applications Responsible for delivering cross-functional reporting, data exploratory analysis and hands-on development of highly visible visualization projects that create strategic and transformational value for key stakeholders. Deep statistical foundation and knowledge of statistical learning theory quantitative/statistical hypothesis analysis, and decision analytics. Translate data results into dashboards, written reports, tables, graphs and charts to convey information to management in a digestible and visually appealing format. Create written communication materials that effectively summarize findings and support recommendations. Leverage data to gain key insight into business opportunities, and effectively presents these insights to business stakeholders. Perform new market and acquisition target analysis in support of growth ambition. Proactively create documentary artifacts like business cases, usage scenarios, solution blueprints, FAQs, meeting notes… etc. Advanced knowledge of common software to build dashboards. Automate reporting for weekly business metrics, identify areas of opportunity to automate and scale ad-hoc analyses.Education  Bachelor's Degree in business, mathematics, computer science, or analytical techniques, advance degree preferred. Equivalent work experience.It is the policy of Knauf Insulation to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic prohibited by applicable law.

title: Salesforce Business Analyst
job_description: Location: 9045 River Road, Indianapolis, IN 46240This is an onsite position, no relocation assistance is offered at this time.Position SummaryUSIC Salesforce Business Analyst is a key player in managing, solving, implementing, and supporting business improvements within the IT team.Business analysts help guide businesses to improve business processes and efficiency in Salesforce. They elicit, document, and analyze requirements around business challenges, and then produce data-driven solutions. Think of the Salesforce business analyst like an interpreter. They’re the go-to person when it comes to communication between IT and business stakeholders to ensure all involved work together to attain the best results.Responsibilities Collaborate with business stakeholders by conducting workshops and interviews to elicit, analyze, and document detailed business requirements to understand current business processes, identify areas for improvement and implement Salesforce projects.Create relationships and build rapport with stakeholders.Articulate the benefits and risks to a solution’s feasibility, functionality, and scalability.Provide current best practice and third-party solution alternatives from the AppExchange.Work closely with technical teams to translate business requirements into functional specifications and design effective Salesforce solutions.Ensure data integrity and accuracy within Salesforce by implementing best practices for data management.Collaborate with necessary IT teams to determine the most appropriate technical strategy and designs to meet business needs.Collaborate with developers to ensure the successful implementation of customizations and integrations.Perform Salesforce administrator functions limited to declarative development (objects, flows, validation rules, reports, etc.) after approval of requirements.Conduct testing activities (unit testing) to validate that Salesforce solutions meet specified requirements.Support stakeholders to achieve timely UAT (User Acceptance Testing) Sign Off, by preparing and running Demos, preparing Test Cases, providing Training, resolving Bugs, and identifying Bugs vs Enhancements.Create user guides and documentation for training purposes.Assist in defining data migration and integration requirements.Offer ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to Salesforce users.Follow and understand new Salesforce products and technical capabilities resulting from product releases and acquisitions.Monitor and track project metrics and provide status updates to Key StakeholdersMaintain comprehensive and accurate documentation of Salesforce configurations, customizations, and processes.Qualifications:2+ years of experience as a Salesforce or IT Business Analyst, preferably in a consulting environment.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Strong understanding of Salesforce capabilities and limitations.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.Product knowledge of Salesforce Sales and Service Clouds.Salesforce certification(s) such as Salesforce Business Analyst or Salesforce Certified Administrator (or able to obtain certification within the first month of the role).Four-year degree or relevant work experience.Visio and JIRA experience, a plus.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Veterans are encouraged to apply.

title: Business Analyst- Customer Service
job_description: Position Title: Business Analyst – Customer ServiceSafety Sensitive: NoSupervisor’s Title: Director of Mobility SolutionsFLSA Status: ExemptDepartment: Mobility ServicesDivision: Operations POSITION PURPOSE The business analyst – Customer Service- will manage and interpret data to improve IndyGo's customer service, support technology projects, and assist with data-driven decision-making in the Public Affairs division. This position will provide critical insights and support regarding opportunities to generate revenue, including creating sales agreements and transit pass programs. The business analyst position will evaluate business processes, financial transactions, and various market data to ensure quality, efficiency, and equity in the customer service program. The salary for this position is $53,000- $59,000 annually. Essential Functions And ResponsibilitiesTo succeed in this role, an individual must perform the functions listed below satisfactorily. The company will make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.Essential FunctionsDocuments customer service business processes to provide training for employees. Analyzes business processes and workflows to identify improvements. Identifies issues and assists in developing systematic resolution in all aspects of customer service operations. Assists with the development of requirements for new technology projects. Tracks, analyzes, and forecasts trends in online and counter-retail sales. Tracks analyzes, and reports customer comment/complaint trends. Assures quality of financial transactions including cash and electronic payments. Supports transit pass programs: reports usage, ensures quality in billing and transactions of executed transit pass agreements with employers, institutions, and social service agencies. Develops and maintains metrics to support marketing and sales campaigns. Facilitates deployment and testing of new hardware and software solutions. Supports Public Affairs on various aspects of program development and evaluation. Assists with project management. Understands and communicates customer perspective, and advocates for issue resolution. Investigates transportation operations and financial data in various software platforms. Critically reviews customer service operations and recommends policies and protocols to safeguard assets. Other FunctionsPerforms other duties as assigned. Education And/Or ExperienceTo perform this job successfully, an individual must have the following education and/or experience.Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Project Management, or a related fieldExperience in managing technology resources is desired. Project Management experience is desired. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Knowledge, Skills, And AbilitiesThe requirements below represent the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.Must have experience using Microsoft Visio, Microsoft SharePoint Project Implementation, and Microsoft 365. Above average technology skills with the ability to use and advise functionality requirements of web-based applications. Ability to develop reports and analyze data to forecast trends. Proficiency in using a computer and related technology, including proficiency with Microsoft Office, the internet, software applications, and aptitude for learning new software or applications. Ability to interact with internal and external constituents in person and through phone, e-mail, and written correspondence. Above-average decision-making and problem-solving abilities. Good presentation skills and the ability to communicate with groups. Above-average mathematical abilities (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division). Ability to prioritize, organize, and manage tasks and time effectively.Ability to operate office equipment, including copiers, fax machines, and phones.  PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here represent those an individual must meet to perform the essential functions of this job successfully.Ability to work in a deadline-oriented office environment. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Ability to remain stationary for extended periods of time and move throughout the workday, occasionally between departments and facilities. IndyGo is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This individual will have a good understanding of:Agile software development Digital platforms and digital user experience The Internet of Things (IoT) Harnessing big data This position will advocate for Toyota's future IoT connected products and enhancements, align IoT functionality with broader digital customer experience strategies and collaborate with technical teams across software, firmware and hardware.Essential Position DutiesDevelop and review development backlog, user stories, and features roadmap Support cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of projects and initiatives Work with product owner and business stakeholders to execute project plans, time frames and prioritization while ensuring all stakeholder expectations are aligned Develop/Write/Review, elaborate, approve, and prioritize user stories and functionality to be built on the platform Actively participate in sprint and release planning Interface directly with internal and external IT and development teams to define requirements, elaborate/refine user stories and set expectations/timelines Support documentation of development, workflows and requirements Support digital quality assurance end-to-end efforts including test cases, test execution and defect triage Improve feedback loops to understand user behavior, new requests, and improvement ideas Participate and drive contract reviews as assigned Practice fiduciary responsibility Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and safe manner Additional duties as assigned Education & ExperienceBachelor's Degree or Higher 3+ Years of Related Professional Experience About Toyota Material HandlingLet Toyota take your career to new heights. We are proud of our large and diverse workforce. We seek individuals committed to excellence with talent, skill and innovation. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package with a pleasant and challenging work environment. title: Business analyst IARD h/f
job_description: MissionDécollage imminent pour une aventure fonctionnelle dans le métier des Assurances !Rejoins nous en tant que Business Analyste Fonctionnel ! Nous recherchons un Business Analyst fonctionnel h/f pour accompagner nos équipes vers les sommets de la compréhension métier.Votre capacité à parler la langue des utilisateurs et à traduire leurs souhaits en spécifications fonctionnelles sera une compétences indispensable au poste.Votre maîtrise de la communication d'équipe, pour accompagner le projet et les parties prenantes seront nécessaire et reconnu pour cette mission.Une connaissance du milieu assurances sera un vrai plus.ProfilCe Que Nous ProposonsEnvironnement de travail innovant et dynamique.Opportunités de développement de carrière.Package de rémunération attractif.Fourchette de rémunération selon votre expertise.OrganisationInetum est un leader européen des services numériques. Pour les entreprises, les acteurs publics et la société dans son ensemble, les 28 000 consultants et spécialistes du groupe visent chaque jour l'impact digital : des solutions qui contribuent à la performance, à l'innovation et au bien commun.Présent dans 19 pays au plus près des territoires, et avec ses grands partenaires éditeurs de logiciels, Inetum répond aux enjeux de la transformation digitale avec proximité et flexibilité.Porté par son ambition de croissance et d'industrialisation, Inetum a généré en 2023 un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 milliards d'€.Pour répondre à un marché en croissance continue depuis plus de 30ans, Inetum a fait le choix délibéré de se recentrer sur 4 métiers afin de gagner en puissance et proposer des solutions sur mesure, adaptées aux besoins spécifiques de ses clients : le conseil (Inetum Consulting), la gestion des infrastructures et applications à façon (Inetum Technologies), l'implémentation de progiciels (Inetum Solutions) et sa propre activité d'éditeur de logiciels (Inetum Software). Inetum a conclu des partenariats stratégiques avec 4 grands éditeurs mondiaux - Salesforce, ServiceNow, Microsoft et SAP et poursuit une stratégie d'acquisitions dédiée afin d'entrer dans le top 5 européen sur ces technologies et proposer la meilleure expertise à ses clients.Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description: Job Title: Senior Business AnalystCompany: American Commercial Barge LineLocation: Jeffersonville, INJob Type: Full-TimeFLSA Status: ExemptAmerican Commercial Barge Line is seeking a skilled Senior Business Analyst to lead ongoing reviews of business processes looking for areas of improvement to develop and implement solutions. This role will serve as a critical role in optimizing organizational efficiencies and use data analytics to draw conclusions and produce forecasts to improve and explain business performance to Senior Leaders.When you join ACBL…American Commercial Barge Line (ACBL) is one of the largest and most diversified marine transportation companies in the U.S. Our legacy of providing the nation with the most economical, safest, and greenest mode of transportation dates all the way back to 1915, when we began moving coal on the Kentucky River. We offer a wide range of career paths in both operations and support services. Whether you are interested in working on the river or in an office, we are always searching for the best of the best to join our ACBL team.What you will be doing... Your IMPACTLead ongoing reviews of business processes looking for areas of improvement to develop and implement solutions.Create reports, analysis, dashboards, and data visualizations for board presentations and company decision making tools within Power BI.Coordinate KPI development working with leaders on developing and deploying recommended improvements.Evaluate data for accuracy and consistency and build effective data visualizations.Communicate with leaders on what they look at to evaluate their performance and assist in developing improvement plans.Facilitate the Continuous Improvement (CI) program for the logistics department and play a critical role in implementing CI process enhancements.Develop and drive innovative solutions for operational and strategic changes.Performs all other duties as assigned. What We Are Looking For...You will need to have:Bachelor’s degree required; preferably in Business, Economics, or Data Analytics.5+ years of analytic work experience preferred, but not required.Advanced knowledge in MS Office software, specifically Excel and PowerPoint as well as Power BI experiencePossesses organizational skills and is results drivenMust be dependable in attendance and meet deadlines as establishedInnovative problem solverAbility to multi-task and prioritizeCritical thinking process orientatedEffective communicator with Senior LeadersMust be able to secure data and ensure confidential access to key stakeholders Reasons you will love working at ACBL …Competitive SalaryCutting-Edge ProjectsIMPACTful WorkOnsite Workout FacilityCollaborative EnvironmentConvenient onsite café offering affordable breakfast and lunch options.Join our dynamic team and contribute to the enhancement of our Salesforce ecosystem, driving business efficiency and effectiveness through innovative solutions. Apply now and be part of our exciting journey!
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: IN DOR - Business Analyst (2 Positions)
job_description: Hello,I hope this email finds you well.Job Title: IN DOR - Business AnalystLocation: Indianapolis, IN 46204Duration: : 6-12 monthsInterview Type:In person onlyThe Business Systems Support Analyst will work collaboratively with staff across the agency to conduct research, gather data, define business and functional requirements, and help with data entry and implementation of projects for Department of RevenueSummary/ObjectiveThe Business Systems Support Analyst will work collaboratively with staff across the agency to conduct research, gather data, define business and functional requirements, and help with data entry and implementation of projects for the Department of Revenue. This position will also play a key role in the partnership between business technical teams. The incumbent's leadership, expertise and work products will establish and operate processes that ensure issues are identified, tracked, diagnosed and resolved. This individual will work to ensure that business needs and plans are successfully integrated with project delivery. The successful candidate will be positive, enthusiastic and team oriented with a passion for identifying, designing, testing, and implementing critical functionality and processes, along with proactive quality assurance. The successful BA will have a strong desire to support the Department of Revenue mission, vision, and Pyramid of Excellence to drive high-quality service delivery and continuous improvement across the agency.Essential Job ResponsibilitiesThe essential functions of this role are as follows: Assists in the development of technical standards and policies to meet the customers, peers, and organization; Formulates and defines system scopes and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with a basic understanding of user needs and business systems and industry requirements: Able to collect data, analyze it, and develop sound reporting to track, recommend and forecast enhancements to the system: Creates process change through the integration of new processes with existing ones and communication of changes to impacted Business Systems teams; Establishes and maintains strategic partnerships with assigned customers in order to help them meet their business and technical needs; Participates in the development of strategic plans based on customer needs; Analyzes business and user needs, document requirements and devises new technical business system solutions, or revises existing system logic difficulties as necessary; Facilitates the delivery of technical business solutions and products to customers; Manages the expectations of customers, peers, vendors, and management; Establishes contracts for the procurement of technical business solutions;Preferred Experience Bachelor's degree in Business or related field or equivalent experience preferred Minimum of two years professional experience in a Business Analyst role preferred Proficiency in meeting leadership and facilitation demonstrated by creating a fun, safe, collaborative and productive work environment Demonstrated capacity to analyze, understand and capture business data and act on findings Creative, disciplined and thoughtful thinker with a demonstrated ability to adjust work plans to determine the appropriate strategy and approach to success Strong project management skills Ability to work with minimal supervision and build credibility with business and IT leaders and varying levels of the organization Ability to maintain a high level of professionalism and confidentiality Ability to accurately and concisely present proposals and solutions to a wide audience Proficient in the use of MS Office suite of products (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project, Word)Requirements Considerable knowledge of project management theories and practices and the ability to apply that knowledge; Ability to lead, encourage and influence others to perform; Effectively communicate both orally and in writing; Ability to manage diverse human resources.Required/Desired Skills Skill Required /Desired Amount of Experience Business Analyst Experience Required 2 Years Technical Writing Experience Required 2 Years Able to collect data, analyze it, and develop sound reporting to track, recommend and forecast enhancements to the system. Required 2 Years Analyzes business and user needs, document requirements and devises new technical business system solutions. Required 2 Years Creates process change through the integration of new processes with existing ones and communication of changes to impacted Business Systems teams. Required 2 Years Proficient in the use of MS Office suite of products (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project, Word) Required 2 Years UI/UX Experience Desired 2 Years

title: Analyst 3 - Business Solutions
job_description: Title: - Analyst 3 - Business Solutions -Location: Memphis / TN / 38118Duration: Long TermMust Haves Knowledge of distribution centre operations Validation document testingJob Description Enhanced SQL skillsThe Distribution Technology Analyst will be responsible for identifying opportunities for technological and operational improvements within the U.S. Distribution Network while following the SDLC systems methodology.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesThis position will be responsible for managing U.S. Regional WMS projects and supporting other projects/initiatives, including business case development, concept / feasibility assessment, project planning, system and process design, key milestone tracking, data pulling and analytics and providing project status updates to the distribution management team.This position will also be responsible for assisting with user acceptance testing, and end user training.In addition, the Senior Distribution Technology Analyst will also be responsible for managing U.S. Regional WMS distribution technology issues/enhancements list, ensuring SDLC methodology is followed, and driving issue resolution. Benchmark and Evaluate logistics processes and technology solutions and improvements across the broader organization.Special RequirementsA minimum of a bachelor's degree in Business, Logistics, Computer Science, Information Systems Management or related field is required. A minimum of 3 years of business and systems experience in health care industry or distribution experience in a fast paced, dynamic, global operation is required.Experience with configuration and execution in a warehouse management application and proficiency with Microsoft applications is required.Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems (SAP, JDE, Etc.), Warehouse Management (WMS) Systems (JDE, JDA, BY, MARC, Etc.) material handling equipment, Warehouse Control (WCS) Systems (Exacta, MDCS, Etc.) and SQL are preferred.Required SkillsProject management experience is preferred.Strong analytical and troubleshooting skillsA track record of process improvement, cost reduction and/or customer service success; results orientedThe ability to communicate and interact effectively across internal departmentsThe ability to influence at various organizational levelsThe ability to manage multiple projects and priorities effectively, and be self-directedThe ability to lead change effortsComfortable working in an ever-changing matrix environmentBig picture orientation with attention to detailSense of urgencyMicrosoft Office proficiency, specifically Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access, Visio, Project and OutlookAbility to manage consultants and work teamsAbility to travel 10-15%Other Skills PreferredOperations knowledge of warehouse management systems (JDE, MARC, PRMS, SAP, BY) and transportation systems within the Medical Device businessExperience working with validated systemsExperience with Process Excellence (Six Sigma and Lean) tools, training, and/or certificationCore Competencies Required For This RoleThe physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

title: BA/QA
job_description: ResponsibilitiesKforce has a client that is seeking a BA/QA in Fort Wayne, IN. Responsibilities: BA/QA will lead workshops and interviews with clear agenda, appropriate and prepared questions related to eliciting specific requirements from variety of business teams Develop business and functional/system requirement documentation Create, update, and validate business processes and technical diagrams Conduct demos, validation workshops and facilitate testing meetings and coordinate user acceptance testing Gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, systems requirements, and test cases Work with key project stakeholders to analyze the feasibility of, and develop requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; Ensure the system design fits the needs of the users As a BA/QA, you will write test plans and test scripts for tracking defects and fixes in product development, software application development, information systems, and operations systems Align activities and estimate effort in support of project plan and keep commitments Report on metrics and progress for requirements, testing, and training activities Prepare test data to meet test case conditions if necessary Perform system/performance/regression testing as well as end-to-end testing with other applications and interfaces Establish quality assurance standards and measures Develop and deliver internal training related to software product rollout(s) Collaborate with developers, analysts, project managers, operations, and stakeholders on testing and deployment activitiesRequirements Bachelor's degree from an accredited degree granting college/university or equivalent work experience 5+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst 3+ years of experience working as Quality Assurance Analyst Experience creating business/functional requirement documents Experience writing use cases and activity diagrams Experience with Azure DevOps or other Quality Management/Testing tool solution Experience with Jira or other Requirements documentation tool or solution Experience creating and delivering training Understanding of business analysis principles and methodologies, including best practices Understanding of quality assurance principles and methodologies, including best practices Proficiency with MS Office applications (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, etc.) Proficient in process mapping tools Proficient in testing and quality assurance tools Excellent communication and collaboration skills Process minded approach with experience building detailed process flows Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasksNice To Have Experience with data analysis, field validation, and mapping Experience with fleet, operations, and/or inventory applications/technology Experience with data taxonomy and data quality Experience with IT methodologies and frameworks such as ITIL, Agile, COBIT, etc. Development and implementation of automated regression testingThe pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.Salary: $55 - $60 per hour
