title: MS Dynamics CRM Business Analyst
job_description: At eimagine, we know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to be intentional in a remote enabled environment to make that possible. Recognized as a Best Places to Work since 2015, we are a team of humbly confident people who are proud of their craft, continuous learners, and have been known to cheer loudly for our teammates. For over 24 years we have been helping clients navigate technology and business change, while staying committed to delivering value & outcomes that enables their success.Due to our growth, we are seeking a MS Dynamics CRM Business Analyst who will be responsible for implementing and supporting CRM applications for clients of eimagine. In addition to sharing our enthusiasm for team collaboration (we promise our secret handshake isn’t hard to learn), you have an unmatched passion for using technology to solve problems and fulfill business outcomes.Description of DutiesServe as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) within all aspects of CRM software to include technical requirements, system configuration, user requirements, and system upgrades Lead and/or participate in requirements gathering and analysis sessions with clients to determine project requirements. Design business processes and integrations between Microsoft Dynamics CRM applications and other applications Extend capability of CRM through creation of new entities, forms, workflows, views and reports Able to elicit and identify project requirements from client end users. Responsible for validating requirements by providing option comparisons and justifications. Capable of providing gap analysis and needs assessments to uncover business need. Accountable for reviewing and finalizing extensive functional and technical documentation. Able to elicit and translate high-level business needs into specific and concise processes. Perform CRM application testing of configurations and customizations. Can provide high-level project/status updates and prepared reports to designated recipients. Accountable for self-organization and tracking completion of assigned tasks including successful delivery of assigned project milestones. Prepare and present training content to clients as needed. Creation of project documentation to include user manuals, training deliverables, business requirements documentation, test scripts and work product validation. Excellent communication skills to include internal/external interaction, documentation and presentations. Experience working in SDLC, testing and validating solutions, and working as a MS Dynamics CRM Business Analyst. Proven ability to self-manage and complete project deliverables. Confident in making decisions, accurate, detailed-oriented and able to problem solve/analyze. Good interpersonal, listening, written and verbal communication and basic project management skills. Functional and/or Technical Certifications as deemed appropriate for specialization. Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science or business administration required

title: Reporting Analyst, Business Services
job_description: Who We AreOn Location is a premium experience provider, offering world class hospitality, ticketing, curated guest experiences, live event production, and travel management across sports, entertainment, and fashion. From unrivaled access for corporate clients to guests looking for fully immersive experiences at marquee events, On Location is the premier and official service provider to over 150 iconic rights holders, such as the IOC (Paris 2024, Milano Cortina 2026, LA 2028), NFL, NCAA, UFC and PGA of America, and numerous musical artists and festivals. The company also owns and operates a number of unique and exclusive experiences, transforming the most dynamic live events into a lifetime of memories. On Location is a subsidiary of Endeavor, a global sports and entertainment company.Endeavor is a global sports and entertainment company, home to many of the world’s most dynamic and engaging storytellers, brands, live events, and experiences. The Endeavor network specializes in talent representation through entertainment agency WME; sports operations and advisory, event management, media production and distribution, and brand licensing through IMG; live event experiences and hospitality through On Location; full-service marketing through global cultural marketing agency 160over90; and sports data and technology through IMG ARENA and OpenBet. Endeavor is also the majority owner of TKO Group Holdings (NYSE: TKO), a premium sports and entertainment company comprising UFC and WWE.The Role And What You’ll DoThe Reporting Analyst will independently formulate and implement reporting solutions that will serve our internal and external clients, including collegiate partners, agents, and vendor partners. The Reporting Analyst will manage the execution of reporting capabilities across the Athletic & Campus Travel business by maintaining and analyzing client travel and expense data, and liaising with clients to improve their business outcomes. Additionally, the Reporting Analyst will oversee procedures for creating efficiencies for the reporting of travel and expense data to our internal and external clients.The individual in this role will understand travel and expense systems, credit card reconciliation processes, and some accounting functions. This person will also understand the processes that support this business and the underlying data elements needed to provide information for decision making and reconciliation purposes. With this knowledge base, the individual will be able to make our clients’ lives easier as it relates to travel expenses through process efficiencies and analysis.Essential Functions & ResponsibilitiesOversees credit card reconciliations and expense integrations for multiple high-value clients, e.g. with volumes in the millions (USD)Serves as resource with expert knowledge for designated collegiate partners and makes recommendations for the development of processes aimed at creating efficiencies regarding travel and expense dataDevelops reporting solutions through the use of Excel and Power BI and determines the most effective method for summarizing and presenting travel data for analysis by clientsOversees the accuracy of client savings reporting which is a critical element for client retention and growthLeads efforts to create reporting solutions for other teams within the Managed Travel Services businessResponsible for online reporting tool, Grasp, for all university and athletic department partners. This includes developing strategies to increase utilization, leading demos, and collaborating with Grasp to improve the technologyLeads efforts for credit card reconciliations and ad-hoc report requestsResponsible for researching and ensuring accurate client reporting data through audits as well as enhancement of processes to increase the accuracy of dataResponsible for researching potential payment solutions, and then developing and implementing processes to achieve efficiencies for credit card and expense reconciliations for clientsInteracts and meets with vendor partners to provide key performance indicatorsTravel Must be adaptable with work and travel schedule and be available to travel for work which may include extended work hours during nights, weekends, and holidays. This position may require up to 20 % travel.You Have These Required Education And/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills, And AbilitiesStrong client-service orientationExperience overseeing high value clients is a plusExcellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skillsExcellent time management skills required – including the ability to set priorities and work in a fast-paced, multi-project environmentProficiency in MS Office Suite, specifically ExcelPower BI experience a plusTeam player, flexibility/ability to adapt in a dynamic environmentStrong desire to learnPositive attitudeSelf-starterWe’d Love If You Also Have ThesePreferred Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Bachelor's Degree in Business or a related field, or equivalent experience requiredTravel experience preferredKnowledge of travel specific systems (e.g. Global Distribution System, Trams, Concur, Grasp, iBank) a plusExperience in collegiate athletics or a university environmentCORE VALUESAs The Leading Experiences Company In The World, We Strive To Be The Most Innovative And Passionate — The Best Of The Best. We Uphold These Values In Our Quest For ExcellenceExceed all service expectations with our customers, our partners, and each other.Create value by enriching people's lives.Do the right thing and bring others along with us — always.Propel the power of diversity, in thought, team and experience.Partner to generate win-win solutions.Ignite and empower our team's entrepreneurial spirit.Exude respect and gratitude — treat others as you would want to be treated.Get To Know Us Betterhttps://www.anthonytravel.com/CompensationCompetitive salary, commensurate with experience, and a generous benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, paid time off, and 401k plan.On Location is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, or genetic information.Endeavor unites and brings people together in our love of sport, culture, and entertainment. We understand this can only be accomplished when we lead with a lens of diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do. As a global company that drives culture, we strive to reflect the world’s diverse voices.  Endeavor is an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, or religion or belief.

title: Business Analyst - Indianapolis, IN
job_description: Job DescriptionATTENTION MILITARY AFFILIATED JOB SEEKERS - Our organization works with partner companies to source qualified talent for their open roles. The following position is available to Veterans, Transitioning Military, National Guard and Reserve Members, Military Spouses, Wounded Warriors, and their Caregivers. If you have the required skill set, education requirements, and experience, please click the submit button and follow the next steps. Unless specifically stated otherwise, this role is "On-Site" at the location detailed in the job post.Position SummaryUSIC Salesforce Business Analyst is a key player in managing, solving, implementing, and supporting business improvements within the IT team.Business analysts help guide businesses to improve business processes and efficiency in Salesforce. They elicit, document, and analyze requirements around business challenges, and then produce data-driven solutions. Think of the Salesforce business analyst like an interpreter. They’re the go-to person when it comes to communication between IT and business stakeholders to ensure all involved work together to attain the best results.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with business stakeholders by conducting workshops and interviews to elicit, analyze, and document detailed business requirements to understand current business processes, identify areas for improvement and implement Salesforce projects.Create relationships and build rapport with stakeholders.Articulate the benefits and risks to a solution’s feasibility, functionality, and scalability.Provide current best practice and third-party solution alternatives from the AppExchange.Work closely with technical teams to translate business requirements into functional specifications and design effective Salesforce solutions.Ensure data integrity and accuracy within Salesforce by implementing best practices for data management.Collaborate with necessary IT teams to determine the most appropriate technical strategy and designs to meet business needs.Collaborate with developers to ensure the successful implementation of customizations and integrations.Perform Salesforce administrator functions limited to declarative development (objects, flows, validation rules, reports, etc.) after approval of requirements.Conduct testing activities (unit testing) to validate that Salesforce solutions meet specified requirements.Support stakeholders to achieve timely UAT (User Acceptance Testing) Sign Off, by preparing and running Demos, preparing Test Cases, providing Training, resolving Bugs, and identifying Bugs vs Enhancements.Create user guides and documentation for training purposes.Assist in defining data migration and integration requirements.Offer ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to Salesforce users.Follow and understand new Salesforce products and technical capabilities resulting from product releases and acquisitions.Monitor and track project metrics and provide status updates to Key StakeholdersMaintain comprehensive and accurate documentation of Salesforce configurations, customizations, and processes.Auto req ID411770BRMinimum Education RequiredHigh School/GEDJob_CategoryOperationsQualificationsAdditional Qualifications/Responsibilities1-2 years of experience as a Salesforce or IT Business Analyst, preferably in a consulting environment.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Strong understanding of Salesforce capabilities and limitations.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.Product knowledge of Salesforce Sales and Service Clouds.Salesforce certification(s) such as Salesforce Business Analyst or Salesforce Certified Administrator (or able to obtain certification within the first month of the role).Four-year degree or relevant work experience.Visio and JIRA experience, a plus.City*IndianapolisState*IndianaJob CodeAnalyst_ _AnalystAffiliate SponsorUSIC

title: Business Analyst III (Pharmaceutical Claims Audit)
job_description: Location: Indianapolis IN, Mason OH, Atlanta GA, Norfolk VA, Tampa FLHours: M - F East coast Hours of OperationTravel: Hybrid 1 ( 1-2 Days onsite per week)Position Overview:  Responsible for handling high level pharmaceutical claim audits and reviewing claims issues from junior team to ensure claims are being resolved and reported in a timely manner. How You Will Make an Impact: Reviews and Audits Pharmaceutical claims processed by vendors to ensure proper complianceConducting Data analysis and issue resolution regularlyActs as a resource to users of PBM software to address questions/issuesVendor interaction and stakeholder management responsibilitiesDevelops project plans and identifies and coordinates resources, involving those outside the unitWorks with programming staff to ensure requirements will be incorporated into system design and testingMay provide direction and guidance to team members and serves as an expert for the team Required Qualifications:  Requires a BA/BS and minimum of 5 years business analysis experience; or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background. Preferred Qualifications:   Pharmacy Claims Audit Strongly preferredPBM (Pharmacy Benefit Management) Software Experience Strongly preferredExperience working in an Agile environment strongly preferredPBM(Pharmacy Benefit Management) Benefits experience preferredHealthcare experience Strongly preferredData analysis and issue resolution experience preferredSQL experience is preferred       If this job is assigned to any Government Business Division entity, the applicant and incumbent fall under a 'sensitive position' work designation and may be subject to additional requirements beyond those associates outside Government Business Divisions. Requirements include but are not limited to more stringent and frequent background checks and/or government clearances, segregation of duties principles, role specific training, monitoring of daily job functions, and sensitive data handling instructions. Associates in these jobs must follow the specific policies, procedures, guidelines, etc. as stated by the Government Business Division in which they are employed.  Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes for compensation from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.Who We AreElevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities - and making healthcare simpler. We are a Fortune 25 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve.How We WorkAt Elevance Health, we are creating a culture that is designed to advance our strategy but will also lead to personal and professional growth for our associates. Our values and behaviors are the root of our culture. They are how we achieve our strategy, power our business outcomes and drive our shared success - for our consumers, our associates, our communities and our business.We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.Elevance Health operates in a Hybrid Workforce Strategy. Unless specified as primarily virtual by the hiring manager, associates are required to work at an Elevance Health location at least once per week, and potentially several times per week. Specific requirements and expectations for time onsite will be discussed as part of the hiring process. Candidates must reside within 50 miles or 1-hour commute each way of a relevant Elevance Health location.The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide an acceptable explanation. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact elevancehealthjobssupport@elevancehealth.comfor assistance.

title: Business Analyst - Medicaid Member
job_description: Great companies need great teams to propel their operations. Join the group that solves business challenges and enhances the way we work and grow. Working at Gainwell carries its rewards. You’ll have an incredible opportunity to grow your career in a company that values your contributions and puts a premium on work flexibility, learning, and career development.SummaryAs a Business Analyst - Medicaid Member at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. Here are the details on this position.Your role in our missionGainwell empowers you show you’re a pro and help clients deliver better health and human services outcomes using innovative technology and solutions. Analyze, plan, design, document and make recommendations to improve business processes to support client’s technological aspirations  Be a supportive bridge between clients, project managers and technical personnel to define, track and communicate business requirements and their expected impact by building basic conceptual data and process models  Create, execute or analyze basic test scenarios to verify that client requirements are built into system design  Ensure that “intent of change” is carried out through every project phase by participating in technical reviews and inspections What we're looking for Three or more years of experience translating technical goals and requirements into real action for clients  Knowledge of basic computer programming concepts such as configuration, development and batch processing  Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel and other software for conducting quantitative analysis is essential  Strong analytical and business process re-engineering skills  Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills to deliver messages to business leaders, clients and technical personnel  An influencer and team player who that motivates others to action and communicates key technical ideas in a digestible way What you should expect in this role Fully remote options from continental US locations only  Video cameras must be used during all interviews, as well as during the initial week of orientation  The deadline to submit applications for this posting is May 7, 2024 The pay range for this position is $ 55,600- $79,400 per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. Put your passion to work at Gainwell. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a company that values work flexibility, learning, and career development. All salaried, full-time candidates are eligible for our generous, flexible vacation policy, a 401(k) employer match, comprehensive health benefits , and educational assistance. We also have a variety of leadership and technical development academies to help build your skills and capabilities.We believe nothing is impossible when you bring together people who care deeply about making healthcare work better for everyone. Build your career with Gainwell, an industry leader. You’ll be joining a company where collaboration, innovation, and inclusion fuel our growth. Learn more about Gainwell at our company website and visit our Careers site for all available job role openings.Gainwell Technologies is committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We celebrate diversity and are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Salesforce Business Analyst
job_description: Job Description:Location: 9045 River Road, Indianapolis, IN 46240This is an onsite position, no relocation assistance is offered at this time.Position SummaryUSIC Salesforce Business Analyst is a key player in managing, solving, implementing, and supporting business improvements within the IT team. Business analysts help guide businesses to improve business processes and efficiency in Salesforce. They elicit, document, and analyze requirements around business challenges, and then produce data-driven solutions. Think of the Salesforce business analyst like an interpreter. They’re the go-to person when it comes to communication between IT and business stakeholders to ensure all involved work together to attain the best results.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with business stakeholders by conducting workshops and interviews to elicit, analyze, and document detailed business requirements to understand current business processes, identify areas for improvement and implement Salesforce projects. Create relationships and build rapport with stakeholders. Articulate the benefits and risks to a solution’s feasibility, functionality, and scalability. Provide current best practice and third-party solution alternatives from the AppExchange. Work closely with technical teams to translate business requirements into functional specifications and design effective Salesforce solutions. Ensure data integrity and accuracy within Salesforce by implementing best practices for data management. Collaborate with necessary IT teams to determine the most appropriate technical strategy and designs to meet business needs. Collaborate with developers to ensure the successful implementation of customizations and integrations. Perform Salesforce administrator functions limited to declarative development (objects, flows, validation rules, reports, etc.) after approval of requirements. Conduct testing activities (unit testing) to validate that Salesforce solutions meet specified requirements. Support stakeholders to achieve timely UAT (User Acceptance Testing) Sign Off, by preparing and running Demos, preparing Test Cases, providing Training, resolving Bugs, and identifying Bugs vs Enhancements. Create user guides and documentation for training purposes. Assist in defining data migration and integration requirements. Offer ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to Salesforce users. Follow and understand new Salesforce products and technical capabilities resulting from product releases and acquisitions. Monitor and track project metrics and provide status updates to Key StakeholdersMaintain comprehensive and accurate documentation of Salesforce configurations, customizations, and processes. Qualifications:1-2 years of experience as a Salesforce or IT Business Analyst, preferably in a consulting environment. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong understanding of Salesforce capabilities and limitations. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Product knowledge of Salesforce Sales and Service Clouds. Salesforce certification(s) such as Salesforce Business Analyst or Salesforce Certified Administrator (or able to obtain certification within the first month of the role). Four-year degree or relevant work experience. Visio and JIRA experience, a plus. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Veterans are encouraged to apply.

title: Product Analyst
job_description: Every day, Heartland, a Global Payments Company, makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our products and unmatched services. Simply, we create meaningful technology centered experiences that enable our customers to prosper. If you want to work like an entrepreneur, support and serve entrepreneurs and bring your expertise to a dynamic team, then Heartland is for you. If it's in your nature to work with a passion to provide tangible solutions for everyone you interact with, then join us and let's see what we can do together.SummaryAs a Product Analyst at Heartland, you will be the functional Subject Matter Expert/go to person to manage requirements and user stories for an Agile scrum team, working with project stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that are aligned with the Strategic Roadmap.Job Details:Serve as the product owner on an Agile development team with co-located and/or remote developers & QA resources. Define and prioritize the solution delivery roadmap and IT backlog to implement the product management vision and strategy, maintaining alignment between product and solution delivery teams. Managing requirements, and collaboratively planning, prioritizing, and tracking work. Evaluate input from multiple stakeholders, both internal and external, to develop detailed functional & non-functional requirements through Agile user stories and other requirements documentation. Translate business requirements into functional requirements, communicate any technical challenges to implementation, and collaborate with the delivery team to recommend acceptable solutions & delivery timelines for stakeholders. Determine the impact of changes to other systems for upcoming projects and releases. Maintain current knowledge of various payment methods & processing flows, card brand regulations, technology and competitive trends in the electronic payment industry. Maintain current industry knowledge and upcoming new technology that could be utilized when developing solutionsIdentify & mitigate gaps with existing systems/processes such as, but not limited to, manual processes that should be automated, security risks and vulnerabilities. Validate application functionality by engaging in design reviews and test case reviews and completing acceptance testing. Determine & manage dependencies between the solution delivery team and other groups including operations and servicing to facilitate the deployment of completed solutions. Collaborate with the Agile team to regularly inspect and adapt the software development processes, evolving procedures and driving continuous improvement. Assist in promoting a positive team culture Other Duties:Will collaborate with outside vendors as a company liaison as needed to ensure company standards are maintained in processes Will assist with other teams to maintain compliance with various organizations to include PCI, SOX, etc. as neededValidate and coordinate release processesUtilize data analysis tools to assist in all duties Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree - MIS - Computer Science - Engineering - Business Technology1-2 years in a Business Analyst role, Product Owner, or similar roles in card processing industryProficient and have demonstrable Leadership and Teamwork skills1-2 years of agile methodologies and (LEAN, AGILE (SCRUM and SAFE) with Waterfall project management methodologyDemonstrated ability to present and facilitate  Preferred:Certified Business Analyst Professional certificationProject Management Professional certificationCertified Scrum Product OwnerSalesforce Certifications Heartland is an equal opportunity employer. Heartland, a Global Payments Company, provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. Those applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application and/or interview process should notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.

title: Oracle EBS MFG Business Analyst
job_description: Office locations: southern part of Providence, RI - Indianapolis, IN - Chicago, IL (Illinois location is actually Champaign, IL located 2 hours south of Chicago and 2 hours west of Indianapolis.) Most preferred locations are Illinois and Indiana.Its onsite work with any of the client locations Role: Oracle EBS MFG Business AnalystStatus: Contract, 18-24 monthsThe client currently has many organizations that use separate instances that are owned by the parent company via acquisition. This has created multiple manufacturing facilities with various types of resource needs. They need to optimize their older system now to maximize their business, but they're not ready to do a major project with an upgrade or replacement of the entire system.The company has multiple locations running PeopleSoft financials, Workday HCM, and Oracle EBS for their manufacturing facilities. The organization plans to use Oracle EBS for the next 18 months and needs to modernize and optimize the workflow and processes of their current system. While the work is maintenance/enhancement, they would also like to optimize in preparation for deeper analysis into Oracle EBS re-implementation or new software selection. The existing environment will need to be better performing There are a lot of areas they are interested in changing/investing in as they expect to use the system another 3-5 years while deciding which direction to go.Environment: Oracle EBS MFG including Order-to-Cash and areas such as OM, advanced pricing, configuration, inventory management, purchasing, and discrete mfg.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain a deep contextual understanding of supply chain and manufacturing operations and the underlying business objectives of those areasServe the Operations team by representing their business objectives when interfacing with the other project team members and by ensuring that their business objectives are a primary component of the deliveryBuild the foundation for the development effort by capturing the business context - problem, current state, desired future state, objectives, business needs and impacted user groupsEnsure requirements are specified in a manner suitable for the intended audience and are understandable, unambiguous and capable of being implemented and testedUnderstand project technology and define how the requirements gathering will be conductedFacilitate requirement meetings; demonstrate extensive experience in facilitating sessions. Use techniques to define scope and requirements during the lifecycle of the projectWrite and review business, user and non-functional/system level requirements and structured requirements documentationEnsure change control and change management procedures are followed within the project team as they relate to requirementsUnderstand business case and project scopeThey have various projects based on each business unit. An example of a project would be:Inventory management and ticket management has an order and need to manufacture, package and ship. They don't have mature processes but would like to create them. Some of the items are to work on perpetual inventory and tobe able to implement inventory management modules. They need to build a homegrown solution for ticket management and order intake. Issue now is that a ticket will be routed through their facility but could get lost. They're unable to track the package as there are no barcodesgkumar@tekintegral.com career@tekintegral.com

title: Senior Logistics Business Analyst (On-Site -Jeffersonville, IN)
job_description: Job Title: Senior Business AnalystCompany: American Commercial Barge LineLocation: Jeffersonville, INJob Type: Full-TimeFLSA Status: ExemptAmerican Commercial Barge Line is seeking a skilled Senior Business Analyst to lead ongoing reviews of business processes looking for areas of improvement to develop and implement solutions. title: Accessibility Business Analyst (Contract)
job_description: Type: Contract onlyDuration: end date Sept 30, 2024Location: RemoteOur Business Analyst Team is a dynamic and integral part of our organization, playing a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business objectives and technological solutions. Comprising talented professionals with diverse skills and backgrounds, the team collaborates seamlessly to analyze, interpret, and translate business needs into actionable insights and strategies. By employing a combination of analytical prowess, communication skills, and industry expertise, our Business Analyst Team drives informed decision-making, process optimization, and the successful implementation of business initiatives.We are looking for an Accessibility Business Analyst who specializes in 508 compliance and mobile responsiveness. In this role, you will be a key player in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions, focusing on ensuring our products are highly usable and includes for all users, across a variety of mobile devices and screen sizes. You will work closely with stakeholders, including developers, designers, product managers, and clients, to gather requirements, analyze business needs, and translate them into actionable insights and specifications that align with accessibility standards and mobile responsiveness guidelines.Essential Functions Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business objectives and requirements for digital products and features. Conduct thorough analysis of existing and proposed digital solutions to identify accessibility barriers and opportunities for mobile responsiveness enhancements. Work closely with design and development teams to translate business requirements into functional specifications and user stories that address 508 compliance and mobile responsiveness requirements. Define acceptance criteria and success metrics for accessibility features and mobile responsiveness enhancements. Conduct usability testing and gather feedback from users to validate the effectiveness of accessibility features and mobile responsiveness improvements. Provide guidance and support to development teams on implementing accessibility best practices and mobile responsiveness techniques. Stay informed about the latest trends, regulations, and best practices in accessibility and mobile responsiveness, and incorporate them into our business analysis processes. Collaborate with Quality Assurance teams to develop test plans and ensure that accessibility features and mobile responsiveness enhancements are thoroughly tested. Communicate effectively with stakeholders to provide updates on project status, identify risks and issues, and facilitate decision-making related to accessibility and mobile responsiveness.Required Education, Experience And Skills Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience as a Business Analyst in software development projects, with a focus on accessibility and user experience. Strong understanding of accessibility standards and guidelines such as WCAG 2.1 and Section 508 compliance requirements. Familiarity with mobile responsiveness principles and techniques for web and mobile applications. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into actionable recommendations. Experience conducting usability testing and gathering user feedback. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Detail-oriented with a strong focus on quality and customer satisfaction. Knowledge of business intelligence tools and data visualization.Work Environment This is a remote position. Candidate must be available during the “core” work hours of 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 pm EST. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.About TCCTCC Solutions is a leading provider of early childhood education and care (ECEC) technology and program services to state and local government agencies for the benefit of children, families, and providers. TCC is a minority-owned business enterprise (MBE) with more than 20 years of experience and 180 team members, including subject matter experts with deep expertise in early childhood business, program, and policy. TCC provides ECEC solutions to state and local agencies nationwide.Our Core Values Building strong, reliable relationships with our employees, our partners and our clients Upholding integrity, honesty and respect Supporting our local community Encouraging continued education and development

title: Logistics Business Systems Analyst II
job_description: Position Summary: The Logistics Business Analyst II will support all aspects of data analytics for the Logistics & Fulfillment (L&F) organization. Provide expertise in data analytics and data mining help create solutions across the Regal Rexnord network. In this role, you will support our strategy for business intelligence solutions and reporting tools with a focus on data mining and analysis. Working as part of the Data & Analytics team, you will create standardized approaches to data mining, reporting and visualization, providing leaders with the business insights needed to make informed decisions in a fast-paced environment. This data will influence decisions impacting operations to include evolving operational effectiveness through continuous improvement processes. Your engagement and insights will support all tactical and strategic needs ensuring expectations across Safety, Quality, Delivery ,Cost and Growth (SQDCG) are met. At Regal Rexnord, you are expected to model our company values and be a brand ambassador. This role will report directly to the Senior Manager, Data & Analytics.Major Responsibilities:Conducts analysis for Logistics & Fulfillment to create accurate and timely decisions for Business results. Communicate findings and recommendations to a large audience. Coach and collaborate with team members. Utilize structured and unstructured data sets to create reporting that is descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and / or prescriptive to drive improvements across the business. Maintain and analyze metrics to assess performance and identify improvements across the areas of Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost & Growth (SQDCG). Develop and maintain standardization related to data visualization. Conduct training when needed to ensure end users can fully leverage reporting tools. Provides effective and actionable scenario analysis, and communication of cost trade-offs to support business needs. Analyze L&F data, using methods such as data mining, data modeling, or cost and benefit analysis. Understand organizational priorities to assist with the design and identification of KPI’s that align with the Business. Creates, identifies, and implements effective dashboards for tracking and KPI Metrics to improve SQDCG performance. Ensures that daily, weekly monthly, quarterly, and yearly KPI’s are prepared and published as appropriate. Balance competing priorities while ensuring initiatives maintain momentum delivering against expected ROI. Additional duties as assigned. Required Education / Experience / Skills: Bachelor’s degree in business Analytics, Statistics, Logistics, Supply Chain Management or operations is preferred. 5+ Years of experience in a logistics operations or analytics related position is a plus. Understanding of basic programming concepts and languages (SQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Python, Java, C+, etc.)General knowledge and skill with Logistics and Fulfillment operationsKnowledgeable in all modes of Transportation – TL, LTL, Ocean, Air, Small PackageProficient with Microsoft office productsProven ability to take on tasks and drive continuous improvement. Knowledge of Snowflake and Microsoft Power BI with demonstrated ability to create intuitive status at a glance dashboards. Experience using data and analytics to measure, track and action KPI’s with a bias towards action and urgency. Intellectual curiosity with a desire to take initiative and find new opportunities for improvement. Travel: Minimal (0% - 10%)BenefitsMedical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug CoverageSpending accounts (HSA, Health Care FSA and Dependent Care FSA)Paid Time Off and Holidays401k Retirement Plan with Matching Employer ContributionsLife and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) InsurancePaid LeavesTuition AssistanceAbout Regal RexnordRegal Rexnord Corporation (“Regal Rexnord”) is a leading manufacturer of electric motors, electrical motion controls, power generation and mechanical power transmission products and sub-systems, serving customers around the world in the general industrial, consumer, commercial construction, food & beverage, and alternative energy end markets, among others. Regal Rexnord sells its products and solutions to OEMs, through distributors, and directly to end-users. Regal Rexnord is a $7.2B company with 36,000 associates globally.You may not know it, but Regal Rexnord impacts your life every day. The company’s products enable the fans in HVAC systems that keep us comfortable; the power source that keeps smart buildings running; the agricultural and food service equipment that keeps us fed; and the conveyer systems that keep e-commerce flowing, to name a few of the applications where our products are used.Regal Rexnord’s business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. This means creating innovative solutions while focusing on both customer needs and the company’s commitment to sustainability. The company’s industrial powertrain and automation solutions offerings are an important part of the company's growth strategy. The company’s strategy includes leveraging 80/20 to prioritize all activities, including product excellence, operational excellence and commercial excellence (i) driving organic sales growth through the introduction of innovative new products, with a particular focus on improving energy efficiency, (ii) establishing and maintaining new customers, as well as developing new opportunities with existing customers, (iii) participating in higher growth end markets and geographies, and (iv) identifying and consummating strategic, value creating acquisitions.Equal Employment Opportunity StatementRegal Rexnord is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, ancestry, national origin, marital status, citizenship status (unless required by the applicable law or government contract), disability or protected veteran status or any other status or characteristic protected by law. Regal Rexnord is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are committed to building a team that represents diverse and inclusive backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If you’d like to view a copy of the company’s affirmative action plan or policy statement, please email Recruiting@RegalRexnord.com. If you have a disability and you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please e-mail Recruiting@RegalRexnord.com.Equal Employment Opportunity PostersNotification to Agencies: Please note that Regal Rexnord Corporation and its affiliates and subsidiaries ("Regal Rexnord") do not accept unsolicited resumes or calls from third-party recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement or similar contract and approval from HR to submit resumes for a specific requisition, Regal Rexnord will not consider or approve payment to any third-parties for hires made.

title: Senior Sales Operations Analyst
job_description: At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.What’s In It For YouBe a part of our mission! As a world leader in creating comfortable, sustainable, and efficient environments, it’s our responsibility to put the planet first. For us at Trane Technologies, sustainability is not just how we do business—it is our business. Do you dare to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities? Do you want to contribute to making a better future? If the answer is yes, we invite you to consider joining us in boldly challenging what’s possible for a sustainable world.The Senior Sales Operations Analyst will support strategic decision making and planning through analysis and enhancement of analytics and KPIs in support of the commercial organization. Analyses for sales operations pertain to sales reporting and analysis, sales forecasting and demand planning, Business Intelligence administration and support of best practices, pricing and margin analysis, compensation development, as well as ad hoc analysis as required. This position will work cross-functionally with Marketing, Accounting, Contracts, Customer Service, Technical Service, Manufacturing, Planning, Purchasing and Sales teams to enable commercial leadership to make effective, analytically driven, and strategic operating decisions. The Sales Operations Analyst will build and execute on compensation programs that increase sales effectiveness. This position is also responsible for helping manage the Customer Relationship Management tool in support of the CRM Specialist and Power BI in conjunction with IT.Thrive At Work And At Home Benefits kick in on DAY ONE for you and your family, including health insurance and holistic wellness programs that include generous incentives – WE DARE TO CARE! Family building benefits include fertility coverage and adoption/surrogacy assistance. 401K match up to 6%, plus an additional 2% core contribution = up to 8% company contribution. Paid time off, including in support of volunteer and parental leave needs. Educational and training opportunities through company programs along with tuition assistance and student debt support. Learn more about our benefits here!Where Is The WorkThis position is virtual.What You Will DoPromotes Trane values as demonstrated in personal productivity and quality of work, management of internal/external relationships, actively seeking out and participating in Continuous Improvement practices, and willingness to engage and support team initiatives. Sales Reporting and Analytics - Create and distribute a wide breadth of standardized and custom reports and analyses. Reports and analysis should be completed in a timely manner with a high level of quality and be easily understood. These reports must be adapted over time as selling conditions/environment changes. Track and explain variances to plan and budget. Migrate standardized reports to Power BI enabling customers to pull data as needed. Determine the most effective way in which data can be presented based on user’s needs. Become subject matter expert for Power BI. Forecasting & Demand Planning – Manage the bookings forecasting process from end-to-end beginning with the annual budget and funnel management to be translated into a demand plan for manufacturing. Emphasis on delivering accurate forecasts on a regular basis for financial reporting and planning. Development of annual bookings plan to serve as the basis for the revenue and profit plan. Ad Hoc Analysis & Projects – Create required reports and analysis to provide decision support for management teams. Examples include trend reports, customer reports, customer segmentation, ROI on marketing promotions and campaigns, etc. Process Improvement – Continuously review and improve current processes and reports to find more efficient ways to update reports and share information with stakeholders. Pricing & Margin Analysis – Perform pricing and margin analysis to assist sales and management in setting pricing. Work with management to develop pricing strategies for multiple channels and purchasing organizations. Ensure that changes in pricing are communicated and updated in all systems. What You Will Bring7+ years in analytical role required. Support of sales or marketing in analytical role preferred.Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Marketing or other analytical/ business fields. MBA preferred.Proficient with Microsoft Office products including Excel, Word and PowerPoint, with advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, if/then statements, nested functions, vlookups, formulas). Microsoft Dynamics CRM and BI experience preferred.Key Competencies: Ability to work independently and collaborate with teams inside/outside the department to reach common goals; open to and solicits diverse views and opinions from others; breaks down barriers to build consensus. Ability to apply professional and technical expertise to identify innovative solutions that meet department and business needs. Ability to clearly communicate quantitative information to all levels of the company. Excellent financial analysis skills with a good understanding of how to manipulate data for analysis and reporting Excellent organizational skills with close attention to detail Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills oral/written communication Ability to understand intricate financial business problems and help determine appropriate solutions Experience in managing multiple reports and diverse priorities Haven’t done every single thing in the job description? At Trane Technologies, we are just as interested in your capabilities as your prior work experience. So, if you are excited about this role but your past work experience doesn’t align perfectly with everything in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the best person for this role.CompensationTotal Target Compensation: Range $90,000 - $111,000 Total Target Cash represents a mix of fixed base salary plus payment from sales commissions. Sales commissions plans are uncapped plans.Disclaimer: This "range" could be a result of seniority, merit, geographic location where the work is performed, education, experience, travel requirements for the job, or because of a system the employer uses to measure earnings by quantity or quality of production (so, for example, positions that may not have traditional salary ranges). Our prosperous commission plans grow over time with a successful employee’s growing pipeline. Some sales professionals may eventually move to 100% commission.Equal Employment OpportunityWe offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs. We are an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status.2403157

(NYSE: ENV) is transforming the way financial advice and wellness are delivered. Envestnet's technology is focused on addressing financial advisors' front, middle, and backoffice needs while leveraging our platform to grow their businesses and expand client relationships.We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package as well as the excitement, challenges, and rewards of a fast-growing, entrepreneurial company.

title: Senior Management Analyst
job_description: Barbaricum is a rapidly growing government contractor providing leading-edge support to federal customers, with a particular focus on Defense and National Security mission sets. We leverage more than 15 years of support to stakeholders across the federal government, with established and growing capabilities across Intelligence, Analytics, Engineering, Mission Support, and Communications disciplines. Founded in 2008, our mission is to transform the way our customers approach constantly changing and complex problem sets by bringing to bear the latest in technology and the highest caliber of talent. Headquartered in Washington, DC's historic Dupont Circle neighborhood, Barbaricum also has a corporate presence in Tampa, FL, Bedford, IN, and Dayton, OH, with team members across the United States and around the world. As a leader in our space, we partner with firms in the private sector, academic institutions, and industry associations with a goal of continually building our expertise and capabilities for the benefit of our employees and the customers we support. Through all of this, we have built a vibrant corporate culture diverse in expertise and perspectives with a focus on collaboration and innovation. Our teams are at the frontier of the Nation's most complex and rewarding challenges. Join us.  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Management Analyst to join our Electro-Optic Technology Division. This division is at the forefront of providing programmatic and life cycle logistics support for a range of Electro-Optical/Infrared (EO/IR) projects. We deliver comprehensive life cycle support for military and national security EO/IR and laser systems, serving the warfighter across various branches including the Navy, USMC, Air Force, and SOCOM. Our focus spans airborne, maritime, and ground electro-optics systems, with an emphasis on product support and logistics to enhance operational readiness and effectiveness. ResponsibilitiesProvide in-depth programmatic support for EO/IR projects, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and compliance with military requirements.Collect, review, and analyze information to assess program performance, identify issues, and recommend solutions.Define the nature and extent of problems affecting EO/IR systems, leveraging analytical methods to pinpoint underlying causes.Devise and recommend actionable strategies to resolve identified problems, enhancing program effectiveness.Compile and present findings and recommendations to Government stakeholders through both written reports and oral presentations.Required QualificationsBachelor's of Science/Arts (BS/BA) in a related field with at least 10 years of experience supporting ACAT I, II, or III programs as a Program Analyst.Active Secret Clearance Required.Knowledge of Earned Value Management, resource management, and risk quantification/analysis.Leadership skills, with at least seven years of experience leading teams in the preparation of program acquisition documentation and presentation material.Preferred QualificationsMaster’s degree in a business-related field with at least 15 years of experience supporting ACAT I, II, or III programs as a Program Analyst.Expertise in Earned Value Management, resource management, and risk quantification/analysis.Proven leadership experience, with at least 10 years leading teams in preparing program acquisition documentation and presentation material.Additional InformationFor more information about Barbaricum, please visit our website at www.barbaricum.com . We will contact candidates directly to schedule interviews. No phone calls please.

title: Senior Special Projects Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionSenior Special Projects AnalystThis position requires an active CBP Public Trust clearance or the ability to obtain a CBP Public Trust clearance.**The Senior Special Projects Analyst will support the Office of Facilities and Asset Management (OFAM) Operational Support Facilities (OSF) in Organizational Change Management efforts taking place across the BPAM PMO including organizational development, design, employee engagement, and support of the Roles and Responsibilities IPT.Compensation & Benefits:Estimated Starting Salary Range for Senior Special Projects Analyst: $110,000 to $119,000 per year. Salary commensurate with experience.Full time benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K and other possible benefits as provided. Benefits are subject to change with or without notice.Senior Special Projects Analyst Responsibilities Include: Organizational Development: Supports continued organizational development efforts across the BPAM PMO including realignment of positions and functions within the PMOs larger structure; coordinate with internal and external stakeholders including OFAM, FM&E Organizational Resources and Support (OR&S), Enterprise Services (ES) CBP Office of Human Resource Management (HRM) and Labor and Employee Relations (LER), to ensure that all entities are apprised of organizational development efforts and have opportunities to provide input; and developing, with the guidance of the Government, plans and justification for hiring, retention and recruitment.Organizational Design: Supports the execution of the BPAM PMO reorganization that was implemented in October 2016. This effort will require the contractor to: implement the Transition Management Plan which outlines the steps necessary to successfully implement a transition of this magnitude; implement the Communications and Outreach strategy and associated documentation required for the implementation of the strategy including talking points, briefing papers, presentations and memoranda; document Lessons learned updated throughout the transition to document successes, challenges and recommendations; develop other documentation as required to effectively implement the transition management plan, and; coordinate with the appropriate points of contact to ensure that all systems are properly updated as a result of the reorganization (i.e., HRBE, Concur, CPRO). Position Description Updating: Develops up to 30 updated Position Descriptions for approval of the Government. Human Resources Support: Acts as a liaison between BPAM PMO and human resource support organizations such as FM&E Organizational Resources and Support (OR&S), and Human Resources Management (HRM). Provide assistance in coordinating information and paperwork in regard to supporting online personnel databases, assisting in the coordination of up to 50 HR packages (i.e., selection, relocation, upgrades, details, and temporary promotions). Roles and Responsibilities (R&R) IPT Support: Assists the Government in the implementation and administration of the R&R IPT. This effort will require the contractor to catalog the roles and responsibilities of each position working within the BPAM PMO including interviewing approximately 150 personnel, aggregating and analyzing data derived from interviews. Perform the administrative functions necessary to keep the R&R IPT on-track including schedule development and monitoring and note and action item capture and monitoring. Track, follow-up on and report on action items associated with the RR IPT process. Service Level Agreement (SLA) Development and Maintenance: Supports the continued maintenance of the SLA’s made between the BPAM PMO and USBP and the BPAM PMO and the OAM. Maintenance efforts will include facilitating the review of the document up to ten times annually through the solicitation of change requests to both BPAM PMO and USBP and AMO, set-up and facilitation of associated SLA Change Control Board (CCB) meetings, tracking approved and denied change requests that result from the SLA CCB meetings and drafting and routing updates to the SLA based on approved change requests. Facilitation and Meeting Preparation: Serves as a facilitator for a variety of meetings and ad hoc projects. This includes setting the agenda, managing the agenda, controlling the meeting environment, tracking action items, distributing meeting minutes, and reporting to stakeholders to ensure everyone is up to speed on project status and next steps. Support the successful planning and execution of meetings and working sessions that have stated goals and/or objectives and require actionable outcomes for the PMO.Performs other job-related duties as assigned.Senior Special Projects Analyst Experience, Education, Skills, Abilities requested: Bachelor’s Degree in a field related to Organizational Change Management/ Human Resources 5 years of experience in Organizational Change Management 5 years of experience in a federal setting Utilizing and applying computer software including Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).Advanced PowerPoint Skills including Presentation/Deck development must be able to have a mastery of presentations utilizing advanced graphics, charts, graphs, and available animations. Advanced Excel skills –mastery of complex if/then statements, match/index, advance pivot, and chart/graphic development and visual basic programming for macro development. Charts and graphs must capture and retain audience attention. Strong written and verbal communication skills.Strong organizational skills.Must be able to obtain a Public Trust. Must have experience using SAP (ERP System). Must pass pre-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal.Company Information: Cherokee Nation Strategic Programs (CNSP) provides support, services, and solutions to federal and commercial customers. The company takes a personalized approach to solving our clients' toughest challenges, helping you make the most of your skills. CNSP is part of Cherokee Federal – a team of tribally owned federal contracting companies. For more information, visit cherokee-federal.com.#CherokeeFederal Senior Strategic Initiatives AnalystSenior Business Development AnalystSenior Operations AnalystSenior Project Management AnalystSenior Corporate Strategy AnalystSpecial projectsAnalystSeniorStrategicOperationsLegal Disclaimer: Cherokee Federal is an equal opportunity employer. Please visit cherokee-federal.com/careers for information regarding our Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Statement, and Accommodation request.Please Note: If you are interested in a future with Cherokee Federal, APPLY TODAY! Although this is not an approved position, we are accepting applications for this future and anticipated need.

title: Senior Warehouse and Transportation Analyst
job_description: For over 65 years, pharmaceutical and biotech companies have partnered with Simtra BioPharma Solutions (Simtra) to bring their sterile injectable products to market. Simtra is a world-class Contract Development Manufacturing Organization with facilities in Indiana, US and Halle/Westfalen, Germany. We offer a wide-range of delivery systems including prefilled-syringes, liquid/lyophilized vials, diluents for reconstitution, powder-filled vials, and sterile crystallization. Our product types include biologics and small molecules, cytotoxics, highly potent compounds, diluents for reconstitution and vaccines – which are all directly injected into patients worldwide. As such, at Simtra, there is a strong emphasis on quality and continuous improvement. We hold ourselves to the highest quality and regulatory standards.While our primary focus is cGMP manufacturing, we offer many support services including formulation and development, lyophilization optimization, global regulatory support, and secondary packaging.In addition to unmatched expertise and experience, we offer a uniquely collaborative approach. title: BSA/AML Systems Implementation Lead
job_description: Who Are We?We’re not just another bank and we’re not looking for just another employee. Since 1999, First Internet Bank has been dedicated to finding a better way to bank and doing things that have never been done before. Yes, we really were the first state-charted, FDIC insured bank to operate entirely online and we have been leading the way ever since.We seek the game changers, the innovators…those who challenge the status quo because change really is the only constant. Ready to join a team of imaginative, driven individuals like you? It’s your career, you deserve to imagine more. Keep reading, we think you will like you what see.About the Position:As a BSA/AML Systems Implementation Lead, you will work closely with and provide support to the BSA/AML and Fraud Operations team and be responsible for the maintenance of and troubleshooting issues pertaining to all BSA/AML/OFAC and Fraud management systems and applications in use by First Internet Bank.You will be responsible for the oversight of the bank’s BSA/AML/OFAC and Fraud prevention and monitoring systems and applications ensuring they perform as designed, including the accurate import of customer and transaction data. You will also be responsible for the ongoing review of existing and new monitoring rules and recommending parameter changes supported by above and below the line testing to management for implementation. The role will also assist in the development and ongoing reporting of key risk indicator and performance metrics to management.What You Will Do:Act as the main point of contact for troubleshooting system issues within the BSA/AML/OFAC and Fraud transactions monitoring systems.Perform ongoing reconciliation of data feeds to the BSA/AML/OFAC and Fraud monitoring systems.Continuously evaluate and recommend changes to the customer onboarding identity and fraud prevention systems.Provide transaction monitoring and customer risk rating system support to the BSA/AML and Fraud Operations team and management.Assist the BSA/AML and Fraud Operations management implementing system changes and projects.Document and report system configuration changes to BSA/AML and Fraud Operations management.Identify, analyze, and implement process improvements for the BSA/AML and Fraud Operations team.Responsible for, in close collaboration with the BSA/AML and Fraud Operations management, the development and ongoing reporting of BSA/AML/OFAC and Fraud related metrics.Perform other duties as assigned.What We’re Looking For:Two or more years of BSA/AML and/or business system analyst experienceSolid understanding of AML software and technologiesBachelor’s degree required; applicant’s overall experience will be taken into considerationResearch and analytical skillsGood organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasksAbility to interact with employees at all levels of the organizationAbility to clearly communicate identified issues or opportunities for improvement, including proposed solutionsWorking Conditions/Demands:Professional office setting.Primarily sedentary position requiring long periods of time working at a computer.Must be able to move throughout the office and buildings to obtain or relay information.Must be able to perform the essential functions of the position with or without reasonable accommodation.
