upgrades.Reviews projects, analyzes business requirements, recommends system changes, writes specifications and implements application changes to address changing application and end user requirements.Contributes to ongoing process to integrate end users requests with software functionality to address changing.Creates and maintains technical documentation and architecture diagrams as required.Analyzes and provides recommendations relating to application configuration and functionality of systems to ensure reliability for current and/or future use.Works directly with project managers to understand application objectives, develop scope of project, outline effort projections, determine schedules, and finalize plans.Establishes and enforces standards, policies and procedures for HRIS related application systems.Participate in the development and implementation of the information technology goals, objectives, policies, and priorities.Assist in assessing the strategic direction of information technology and in developing strategic plans for use of new technology.What You’ll BringBachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or 10 years of experience in an Information Technology environment.Five years experience in HRIS discipline as an Information Technology Analyst or a related function performing user support, training, and supporting installation, development, and maintenance of the business application software and servers, including the development of associated metadata and user interfacesWorking knowledge of MS title: Supply Chain Planning Engineer
job_description: Career AreaSupply Chain and LogisticsJob Description Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it. Supply Chain Planning Engineer  Lafayette, Indiana  Relocation Assistance Available  The Supply Chain Planning Engineer  will be part of the Supply Chain Planning team supporting the Supply Chain Planning Strategy around sourcing/resourcing impacting Lafayette Engine Center and leading Supply Chain projects to develop Supply Chain solutions to support critical business initiatives.Responsibilities Job Responsibilities, include but are not limited to:  Performing Supply Chain Planning Analysis utilizing Plan For Every Part Workbook and other tools to ensure Supply Chain parameters aligned with facility targets.  Represent Supply Chain in sourcing council and New Source Introduction gateway meetings.  Ensuring Supply Chain planning work has been completed prior to implementation of resource.  Lead internal Supply Chain teams to develop & implement Supply Chain solutions to meet project requirements.  Develop project reports and provide regular communication to Management/Stakeholders on project status.  Incumbent is required to work effectively with diverse, multi-functional teams in order to apply the Supply Chain Planning process.  Incumbent will be the liaison between Purchasing and Supply Chain for all supplier resourcing activities: including resource transition, sample orders and resource inventory buffer.  Investigating and incorporating industry benchmarks, metrics and best practices to develop optimal supply chains for suppliers and/or product sets.  Problem Solving: Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply knowledge of problem solving appropriately to diverse situations.  Project Management: Knowledge of effective project management strategies and tactics; ability to plan, organize, monitor, and control projects, ensuring efficient utilization of technical and administrative resources to achieve project objectives. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree related to Supply Chain, or equivalent experience AND 3 years of progressively responsible supply chain job experience  Advanced knowledge and ability to effectively use Microsoft Office tools such as Excel & Power Point  Effective communicator, excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate across all management levels.  Strong understanding and previous experience using common supply chain systems (e.g. MAMM MRP, Lognet, MRC, EDI, MESL, FRACS and Pull Manager), and the ability to coordinate facility efforts.  Must possess excellent leadership skills to effectively lead supply chain improvements making the best use of available resources, while maintaining strong people focus.  Must possess extremely strong collaborative, interpersonal and negotiation skills in order to drive common supply chain processes across multiple departments within a business division.  Must have advanced analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to creatively solve very complex problems.  Thorough understanding of company policies and procedures and solid product knowledge Top Candidates Will Also Have Masters degree related to supply chain.  7 years of progressively responsible supply chain job experience  Prior experience as a buyer and/or leading critical projects to support business initiatives.  Experience and knowledge about CPS supply chain principles, Supply Chain Planning analytical tools, and inventory management.  6-Sigma training and experience.  Previous experience as a Supply Chain Planning Analyst or Engineer is a plus.  Ability to thrive in an uncertain environment and work independently with a sense of urgency. Additional Information Location of this position is in Lafayette, IN  Relocation assistance is available for this position.  This position may require less than 10% travel.  Sponsorship is NOT approved for this position.  This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants for this position that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S. which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO). All qualified individuals - including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.Relocation is available for this position.Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position. This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers.Posting DatesApril 25, 2024 - May 7, 2024Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community .

title: Senior Data Analyst - Python & Power BI
job_description: About BNP Paribas India Solutions:Established in 2005, BNP Paribas India Solutions is a wholly owned subsidiary of BNP Paribas SA, European Union’s leading bank with an international reach. With delivery centers located in Bengaluru, Chennai and Mumbai, we are a 24x7 global delivery center. India Solutions services three business lines: Corporate and Institutional Banking, Investment Solutions and Retail Banking for BNP Paribas across the Group. Driving innovation and growth, we are harnessing the potential of over 10000 employees, to provide support and develop best-in-class solutions.About BNP Paribas Group:BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank and key player in international banking. It operates in 65 countries and has nearly 185,000 employees, including more than 145,000 in Europe. The Group has key positions in its three main fields of activity: Commercial, Personal Banking & Services for the Group’s commercial & personal banking and several specialized businesses including BNP Paribas Personal Finance and Arval; Investment & Protection Services for savings, investment, and protection solutions; and Corporate & Institutional Banking, focused on corporate and institutional clients. Based on its strong diversified and integrated model, the Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings, and protection insurance. In Europe, BNP Paribas has four domestic markets: Belgium, France, Italy, and Luxembourg. The Group is rolling out its integrated commercial & personal banking model across several Mediterranean countries, Turkey, and Eastern Europe. As a key player in international banking, the Group has leading platforms and business lines in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas as well as a solid and fast-growing business in Asia-Pacific. BNP Paribas has implemented a Corporate Social Responsibility approach in all its activities, enabling it to contribute to the construction of a sustainable future, while ensuring the Group's performance and stabilityCommitment to Diversity and InclusionAt BNP Paribas, we passionately embrace diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all employees are valued, respected, and can bring their authentic selves to work. We prohibit Discrimination and Harassment of any kind, and our policies promote equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants, irrespective of, but not limited to their gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, colour, national origin, age, religion, social status, mental or physical disabilities, veteran status etc. As a global Bank, we truly believe that inclusion and diversity of our teams is key to our success in serving our clients and the communities we operate in.About Business line/Function:The Intermediate Holding Company (“IHC”) program structured at the U.S. level across poles of activities of BNP Paribas provides guidance, supports the analysis, impact assessment and drives adjustments of the U.S. platform’s operating model due to the drastic changes introduced by the Enhanced Prudential Standards (“EPS”) for Foreign Banking Organizations (“FBOs”) finalized by the Federal Reserve in February 2014, implementing Section 165 of U.S Dodd-Frank Act.The IT Transversal Team is part of the Information Technology Group which works simultaneously on a wide range of projects arising from business, strategic initiatives, regulatory changes, and reengineering of existing applications to improve functionality and efficiency.Job Title:Senior Data AnalystDate:13/02/2024Department:IHCLocation:MumbaiBusiness Line / Function:CIB IT TransversalReports to:(Direct)AVPGrade:(if applicable)NA(Functional)Number of Direct Reports:NADirectorship / Registration:NAPosition PurposeThe position involves the candidates to take lead as a owner for ensuring proper governance and controls that are being implemented and get it done from the team/ onshore. He should set up governance and control process for new projects being implemented leveraging our existing framework and building / improving upon it.The position involves the candidates to work as individual contributor to deliver solutions which involves:Requirement gathering – Work with requirement providers and onsite team based in Jersey City to gather and analyze requirements, conduct, and participate in meetings / workshops to understand requirements. Analysis – Conduct functional/ Technical/ impact analysis. Write functional / Technical specifications for offshore development team based in Mumbai.Data Preparation and Reporting- Data transformation / wrangling using Alteryx and Creating Power BI reports as per the requirements of Onshore on the Data outputs of Alteryx to show the trends, correlations between facts and dimensions. Defining of KPI’s and assist, guide in better visualization of the data to bring out insights. Testing – Support SIT / UAT and Regression testing. Create test cases as needed for testing. Update the tools for governance and management on daily / weekly basis to track the progress of work. Work on defect resolution on defects raised by Users.ResponsibilitiesDirect Responsibilities; Able to Manage and govern projects. Ensure that documentations are to mark for any audits. Ensure proper reporting and support to higher management. Able to analyze huge data as an Individual contributor and identify any functional gaps on Data front and Data Quality. Perform detailed analysis on data / functional gaps, conduct / organize sessions with Stakeholders/ Clients, to discuss / brainstorm these gaps and present these functional gaps in a summarized manner to Domain Stakeholders/ Clients. Work extensively on Data preparation using Alteryx and some Reporting using Power BI on the Analysed data set to provide business insights. Explain the analyzed data sets on data gaps to business/ Data providers so that they can provide the correct data sets for the delivery. Develop test cases if required aimed at validating development for a given requirement and record them in the official test management platform. Support and help team in above tasks and guide them when required.Contributing Responsibilities: Partner with Onshore leads to present the created solution, Share the knowledge and provide training if required. Produce and distribute daily/weekly/Monthly team Status reports and contribute to project status reporting depending on the undertaking at hand Look at improving the existing process and refine them as we move forward. Create Documentation as per the project need, perform knowledge transfer and cross training for proper backup in team. Perform knowledge transfer and cross training for proper backup in teamTechnical & Behavioral Competencies Experience in Power BI tool. With hands on experience on Power Query, Advanced DAX function, M query. Good Knowledge of building and enhancing various data models for extraction of required data sets to be consumed for PBI reporting. Able to work with different data sets and create relational models. Good hands-on experience of SQL with query optimization techniques. Ability to Adapt to new technologies and flare to learn and implement projects with new technologies. Experience in Python to do data manipulation/ Analysis for various data models for reporting will be preferable but person should be willing to learn and work on Python if the team demands.Specific Qualifications (if Required)Bachelor’s degree in computer application, MCA or BE and inclination on Data Analysis and Dashboarding and data science with experience in the below: - Data Analysis and Dash boarding. Data preparation for reporting Project and Documentation management / maintenance for the projects.Skills ReferentialBehavioural Skills: (Please select up to 4 skills)Ability to collaborate / TeamworkOrganizational skillsCommunication skills - oral & writtenAbility to share / pass on knowledgeTransversal Skills: (Please select up to 5 skills)Analytical AbilityAbility To Develop Others & Improve Their SkillsAbility to manage / facilitate a meeting, seminar, committee, training…Ability to manage a projectAbility to develop and adapt a processEducation Level:Bachelor Degree or equivalentExperience LevelAt least 7 yearsOther/Specific Qualifications (if Required)Great organization skills and understanding of documentations for the project and its completion.A self-starter who can take analyze data and create data models and Dashboards.Ask questions and gather clear functional understanding and business requirement for the tasks assigned. Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) Excellent organization, analytical and time management skills. Ability to work under pressure and flexible to work extended hours or weekend working. Ability to work independently and become an effective team member.B.Tech / B.E. Or MCA Or BCA Or Any Graduate with Data Analysis and reporting experiencePrimary LocationIN-KA-BangaloreJob TypeStandard / PermanentJobDATAEducation LevelBachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)Experience LevelAt least 7 yearsScheduleFull-time

title: Senior HRIS Analyst - SuccessFactors
job_description: SummaryAs a Senior HRIS Analyst you will be a key member of our People Tech team, responsible for leveraging your technical expertise to develop and enhance HR processes, applications, and systems. You will play a critical role in building new, improved processes, configuring systems, and enhancing our current SuccessFactors platform to meet the evolving needs of our organization.Responsibilities Process Improvement: Collaborate with HR and business stakeholders to identify opportunities for process optimization and automation, leveraging technology solutions. Application Development: Design, develop, and deploy custom applications, tools, and utilities to streamline HR processes and improve operational efficiency. Configuration Projects: Lead small-scale configuration projects within SuccessFactors, including module setup, workflow design, and system customization. System Maintenance: Proactively monitor, maintain, and enhance the functionality of our SuccessFactors systems, ensuring optimal performance and reliability. Ticketing System: Design, implement, and manage ticketing capabilities within our HRIS environment, providing efficient support and resolution for user inquiries and issues. Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including technical specifications, user guides, and training materials for HRIS processes and applications. Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on HRIS applications and processes, ensuring effective utilization and adoption. Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in HRIS, contributing to ongoing process improvement initiatives.Requirements Bachelor’s degree in information systems, or a related field. 8 years of experience in HRIS administration, with a focus on technical solutions and system configuration. Preferred hands-on experience with SuccessFactors configuration and customization, including modules like Employee Central, Performance & Goals, Recruiting (RCM), Compensation, etc. Solid understanding of HR processes and best practices, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and propose effective solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Proven track record of managing multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment. SFx Certifications in SuccessFactors or relevant HRIS platforms are a plus.About UsChobani is a food maker with a mission of making high-quality and nutritious food accessible to more people, while elevating our communities and making the world a healthier place. In short: making good food for all. In support of this mission, Chobani is a purpose-driven, people-first, food-and-wellness-focused company, and has been since its founding in 2005 by Hamdi Ulukaya, an immigrant to the U.S. The Company manufactures yogurt, oat milk, and creamers – Chobani yogurt is America's No.1 yogurt brand, made with natural ingredients without artificial preservatives. Following the 2023 acquisition of La Colombe, a leading coffee roaster with a shared commitment to quality, craftmanship and impact, the Company began selling cold-pressed espresso and lattes on tap at 32 cafes, as well as Ready to Drink (RTD) coffee beverages at retail.Compensation Range: $108,000.00 - $162,000.00, plus bonus.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst Location: On site - Plainfield, IN (With flexibility)Rate: Up to $50 per hour Job Type: CTH Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Financial Analyst with expertise in Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) to join our dynamic team. This is a newly created role with a unique opportunity for an adaptable professional to shape and grow with the position. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in collaborating with key stakeholders, including the CFO, accounting team, Operations (COO), Sales (CMO), and board members. Responsibilities:Managing Budgeting/Forecasting Model: Lead the development and management of budgeting and forecasting models, ensuring accuracy and alignment with organizational goals.KPIs and Dashboard Creation: Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) and dashboards, focusing on the sales and operational aspects of the business to provide insights for strategic decision-making.Monthly and Annual Variance Analysis: Conduct thorough variance analyses on a monthly and annual basis to identify trends, opportunities, and risks, providing actionable recommendations.Ad Hoc Projects: Undertake a variety of ad hoc projects to support strategic initiatives, contributing to the overall financial health and performance of the organization.Excel Savvy: Demonstrate advanced proficiency in Excel for financial modeling, data analysis, and reporting purposes.Adaptability and Fluidity: Possess a demeanor that is adaptable to change, embracing a fluid role that continues to evolve and define itself over time.Key Collaborations:CFO and Accounting Team: Work closely with the CFO and accounting team to ensure financial accuracy, compliance, and strategic alignment.Operations (COO) and Sales (CMO): Collaborate with key operational and sales leaders to align financial strategies with overall business objectives.Board Exposure: Interface with the board, providing insights and reports to support informed decision-making at the strategic level.

title: IN-IDOH Governance Analyst
job_description: Hi ,Hope you are doing safe and healthy!!We're #hiring. Know anyone who might be interested?We have an urgent requirement for" IDOH Governance Analyst" If you are available and interested in this position, then please #share your updated resume at sai.kumar@stiorg.com or you can either #call me at 6199190103Job Title: Governance AnalystLocation:2 N Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46204Description:The Governance Analyst position, within the Office of Data & Analytics (ODA), supports key data governance initiatives in alignment with Project Data, Analytics, Reporting, and Technology Transformation (DARTT).Position DescriptionAs a member of the Office of Data & Analytics (ODA) and under the direction of the Data Governance Lead, the Governance Analyst (GA) will collaborate with the agency divisions and regional support teams to document proposed technical/data solutions, processes, policies, standards, best practices, and the like. The GA will represent these needs to agency management and executive leadership and engage in both strategic and operational planning for the continuous improvement of generating the various technology and data outcomes in alignment with the agency's 2021-2025 strategic plan and objectives.Job DutiesDevelop and manage metadata and data dictionaries for IDOH principal data assets.Identify the technical metadata sources, define business contextual enrichment requirements, define user training requirements, and define user access permissions needed to support the business use cases.Assume overall responsibility for the successful execution of assigned data governance projects.Provide assistance to IDOH divisions for the creation of data governance initiatives and KPIsWork to create and maintain robust data documentation for all IDOH data sources, in partnership with the Data Engagement, Data Management and Data Engineering teams.Assist in the roll out of the IDOH data governance framework, with a focus on improving data quality and protecting sensitive data through enhancements to existing policies/procedures, standards, governance metrics, tools and data architecture.Collaborate with the Data Management and Data Engineering teams to design data quality checks to ensure validity and cleanliness of agency datasets prior to their use in analysis reporting.Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of IDOH principal data assets.Serve as a liaison between IDOH division and technical teams to ensure that data-related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined communicated, and well-understood as part of operational prioritization and planning.Assist with the development and maintenance of an inventory of IDOH information maps, including authoritative systems and owners.Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, and adoption requirements across the agency.Assist Data Governance Lead and Director of Data Operations, Governance and Engagement with identifying new opportunities for data governance improvement throughout the agency and mobilizing resources to implement change.Resolve issues escalated from IDOH division data governance representatives.Provide progress reports to leadership and oversee periodic updates to the data governance roadmap.Identify new business opportunities pertaining to the use of data assets to achieve efficiency and effectiveness; represent data as a strategic title: Senior System Analyst
job_description: Job Title: Sr. Systems AnalystLocation: Indianapolis, INDuration: 3-month contract-to-hireSalary: $80-90,000 (Based on Experience)Summary:The Senior Systems Analyst, manages operations and maintenance of the wide area network, voice network and voice equipment over 25 locations. The Senior Analyst is responsible for the installation and maintenance of two data centers and all services and equipment therein. The Senior Analyst designs, directs, and manages information security activities including disaster recovery, intrusion detection, data backup and archiving; administers mid-range equipment, Unix, and Linux operating systems.Responsibilities:• Designs, deploys, manages, and supports data network, internet connectivity and firewalls; monitors network security rules and mechanisms; implements network hardware upgrades and topology changes and troubleshoots problems. Manages vendor relationships for the supply of external internet services. Supports centrally managed wireless network.• Deploy, manages, and supports Unix and Linux based servers; installs system upgrades and troubleshoots problems.• Designs, deploys, manages, and supports telecommunication and voicemail systems; installs and maintains paging system; supports badge communication system.• Deploys and supports VMware virtual infrastructure, virtual servers, and Storage Area Network; balances virtual system utilization.• Design, deploys, and manages and supports security and disaster recovery methodologies; monitors and maintains systems and procedures that secure network and databases; identifies potential security hazards, determines security violations, and recommends procedures.• Maintains network and computing infrastructure at 2 data centers and 25 additional locations.• Plans and implements physical cable plant upgrades; diagnoses and repairs cable plant issues.• Consults for IT management on technology related projects; attends meetings, participates as technical member on various teams for Facilities Department.• Assist with preparing the equipment and software list of requirements for e-Rate process: RFPs, RFIs, RFQs, and SOWs; leads vendors’ pre-conference meetings; and evaluates and ranks vendors’ submitted proposals.• Contributes to the development and maintenance of Business Continuity Plan and Cyber Response Plan.• Monitor equipment for end-of-life/support and make recommendations for purchases.

title: Retail Quality Control Analyst
job_description: Job SummaryThe Retail Quality Control Analyst is responsible for conducting a thorough review of all new deposit accounts . They play a critical role in maintaining the reputation of the brand and ensuring customer satisfaction. They will assure the bank is adhering to regulatory compliance standards, accuracy of financial transactions, oversight and updates to internal procedures, and efficiency of operations. They will communicate any findings with Retail Leadership and Banking Center employees, while also partnering with the Compliance/BSA department on account closures due to missing documentation or information. Based on overall volume, may also review IRA documentation and transactions, Reg CC transactions and notices, etc.Duties And Responsibilities Perform duties to ensure bank documentation, processes, and procedures are adhering to established policies and following regulatory controls and guidelines  Review daily new account reports to ensure all required documents were proved for each new account  Review signature cards, identification documentation, business account documentation, documents for Trusts, POAs, Estates, etc. for accuracy and compliance  Review file maintenance/corrections for accuracy and verify all documentation was collected  Develop and implement quality assurance processes and procedures for retail operations  Provide guidance to retail staff on quality assurance best practices  Conduct regular CIP reviews to ensure compliance with company standards and policies  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address quality concerns and implement corrective actions  Maintain detailed records and documentation of quality assurance activities  Identify areas for improvement and making recommendations for process enhancements  Serve as a liaison between Retail Banking and the BSA Department  Collaborate with others on Retail policies, procedures, and guidelines  Communicate quality assurance metrics and findings to management  Performs other duties as assigned Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent required  At least two years of quality control of account documentation review and account opening preferred.  Understanding of banking regulations and requirements such as: Know Your Customer, Customer Due Diligence, CIP and individual and entity required documents.  Experience in retail banking operations  Must be flexible, take initiative, project a high level of enthusiasm, make decisions, accept responsibility.  Have the ability to think out of the box, work independently, accept feedback, and consider the opinions of others.  Highly organized, with excellent oral and written communication.  Strong attention to detail  Excellent problem-solving skills  Interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders  Must be able to work under stress, handle difficult situations, and juggle multiple priorities.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Products with a strong knowledge of Excel  Perform duties and make decisions under frequent time pressures. About UsFor over a century, Peoples Bank has served as a cornerstone of customer commitment, helping our communities thrive and continuously supporting our community members. Proudly bearing the Finward name as a Finward Company, our logo symbolizes our unwavering dedication to financial excellence, advanced technology, and elevating the customer journey.Headquartered in Munster, Indiana, Peoples Bank offers an extensive array of consumer, business, and wealth management solutions, alongside cutting-edge digital banking services. With 26 conveniently located Peoples Banking Centers spread across Northwest Indiana and Chicagoland, we uphold a tradition of delivering top-notch performance to our valued residents.At Peoples Bank, we are driven by a passion for fostering success within our customer base and communities. Anchored in our core values of Stability, Integrity, Community, and Excellence, we are committed to building strong partnerships with our customers and communities to help them achieve financial success. Through innovative engagement and technology, we ensure an exceptional customer experience at every turn. Peoples is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.  Equal Housing Lender / Member FDIC

title: Credit Review Analyst II
job_description: SummaryDescription  Summary of This Role Routinely monitors existing merchant accounts and relationships for potential risk exposure to the company and assists management in mitigating losses. Effectively interacts with merchants, sales representatives, Senior Credit Review Analysts and Management to achieve timely review of accounts, in mitigating loss and in protecting the company against fraud and other risks. Ensures changes to the merchant’s credit and financial history and the economic environment continues to meet acceptable risk standards. Reviews accounts and ensures compliance with laws, bank regulation, corporate and divisional credit review and underwriting policies and standards on accounts. Reviews accounts in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and compliance with Company, Sponsor Bank and Legal, Policy and Procedures. What Part Will You Play?  Thoroughly understand the risks associated with the payment processing industry (Fraud, Credit, Regulatory, Legal, etc.)  Applies in-depth credit knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and corporate operations practices.  Independently reviews accounts as determined by review guidelines within approval authority, consistent with credit policies and guidelines.  Verify that change request information provided and supporting documentation is correct and consistent with required standards.  Call merchants regarding their accounts when needed to verify information.  Uses advanced knowledge and judgment to complete more complex credit review decisions.  Performs advanced analysis of credit reports, business and personal financials, tax returns and other similar documentation.  Proficiency in all credit review processes and policies, and be able to communicate that knowledge verbally and in writing to other staff.  When risk exceeds the Credit Review Analyst II approval authority, provide a write-up and recommendations to management.  Communicate decisions effectively in both verbal and written communication.  Properly file paperwork.  When requested, consult with Mgt. on procedural and policy changes, concerns or clarifications.  When requested, assist Mgt. with training and development of personnel.  Review files from other staff for accuracy.  Assist in audits and periodic credit reviews for management.  Negotiate collateral or contract changes with merchants when it is determined that the original request cannot be accommodated.  Evaluate and make recommendations to Manager and Director, and where required Corporate review on accounts beyond individual approval authority.  Responsible for preparing large complex accounts for Corporate Credit review.  Prepare spreadsheets and detailed written reports to be presented to management.  Monitors chargebacks, mitigate losses, manage tight deadlines  Take initiative to identify opportunities for process improvements  Additional primary duties will be assigned as required  May serve on special project resource teams as assigned.  Maintain knowledge acquired from the credit underwriting team and demonstrate competency as it relates to knowledge of that area. May complete underwriting of net new accounts periodically to address volume peaks in Underwriting.  Mentor lower level analysts and underwriters.  What Are We Looking For in This Role?   Minimum Qualifications  HS Degree or equivalent  Typically minimum 2 years relevant experience in finance/accounting, credit, risk or equivalent experience in a related field required.  Business and consumer credit and exposure analysis skills.  Ability to read/review/analyze personal and business financial statements, interpret credit bureau reports, analyze trade experience, tax documents, and utilize external financial resources.  Strong analytical and process skills.  Strong communication (written and verbal), customer service, multi-tasking skills. Preferred Qualifications Bachelors Degree in Finance or related field  In-depth credit operations knowledge, industry standards, corporate policy and operational practices.  Previous experience with Salesforce preferred  Advanced knowledge and judgment to complete more complex credit decisions.  Advanced proficiency in all underwriting processes and policies, and be able to communicate that knowledge verbally and in writing to other staff.  What Are Our Desired Skills and Capabilities?  Skills / Knowledge - Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.  Job Complexity - Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Builds productive internal/external working relationships.  Supervision - Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments.
Industries: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting

job_description: JOB REQUISITIONAmericas Delivery Center Analyst-ControlsLOCATIONAMERICAS DELIVERY CENTERADDITIONAL LOCATION(S)Job DescriptionYou Belong HereThe Protiviti Career provides opportunity to learn, inspire, and advance within a collaborative and inclusive culture.  We hire curious individuals for whom learning is a passion. Imagining our work as a journey, we believe integrity guides our way, inclusion moves us forward together, innovation creates new destinations, and our commitment to success empowers us to deliver on our vision to be the most trusted global consulting firm.Where We Need YouProtiviti’s Americas Delivery Center is seeking an Analyst to join our controls competency. Embracing Protiviti’s vision of “Bringing Confidence to a Dynamic World,” the Americas Delivery Center (ADC) provides cost-effective, tech-enabled, and standardized services at scale, to drive efficiency into our service delivery processes in support of our global clients.What You Can ExpectAs part of Protiviti’s ADC team, our delivery center staff will collaborate and accomplish tasks for the project assigned to them in support of Protiviti’s Solution offerings – Technology, Risk and Compliance, Internal Audit & Financial Advisory, and Business Performance Improvement. The understanding of business processes, technical skills, project requirements, and the client’s business in a variety of industries. You value serving on a team and promoting a positive culture that fosters open communication among all members.  You have the ability to be innovative and come up with solutions for problems. You are adaptable and enjoy working on a variety of projects and tasks.   Do Your Talents Include the Following?Ability to work collaboratively with many cross functional teams and stakeholders. Ability to absorb new knowledge and information to develop new skills. Flexibility to adapt to changing roles and requests. Ability to articulate key findings and results both written and verbally. Being coachable and receptive to feedback. Being detail oriented and organized. title: Senior Systems Analyst
job_description: SUMMARY:The Senior Systems Analyst will have the responsibility as the primary liaison between the I/T Department and distribution areas. This person reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs to create test plans, business, technical specification, and user training documents. Will work with users and developers during all phases of development including analysis, design, testing, implementation, and post-implementation. Proficiency required in SQL for analyzing operation trends and to verify hypothesis and testing modules. Additionally, serves as the Analyst for non-technical projects, conducting process evaluations, workflow studies and making recommendations for change and improvement.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Interview users to determine business requirements. Write Business Requirements and Technical Specifications Documents representing the business’ needs and those of the users. Support developers during the coding phase, answering questions and working as a go-between for I/T and Operations staff members. Participate in system design and documentation spanning all aspects of operating a large modern Distribution Center, including Order Management, WMS (Warehouse Management System), TMS (Traffic Management System), multiple Picking technologies including Pick-To-Light, Pick-To-Voice and Goods-To Person, RF (Radio Frequency), Inventory Management and financial systems. Execute system testing and user acceptance testing, writing, and executing test plans and finding issues and inconsistencies in new and existing systems. Perform data extractions using SQL and other data manipulation tools, to create reusable test sets for both their own testing and that of the development team. Develop and maintain user training and reference documents for new processes in all areas of the business. Conduct user training classes. Create queries and format results for testing verification and ad hoc research topics. Participate in the production support on-call rotation within the I/T department. ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Investigates and confirms that the design and implementation strategies have been completed. Determines trends through datamining of production and history databases. Special assignments as designated by director. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: N/AQUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:To perform this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.SKILLS REQUIRED:Excellent communication skills required for the creation of business requirements to define functional and technical specifications for I/T systems. This involves analysis and clarification of business requirements to support management of data and workflow processes and submit recommendations for possible solutions. Good analytical skills needed to prepare detailed process and program specifications, as well as data models and data element definitions. Must possess good working knowledge of fundamental business and system concepts, practices, and procedures. The ability to use SQL to research operational trends and verify testing. Must be results driven and take appropriate steps to achieve goals while taking ownership of situations as needed. Proven ability to deliver timely, accurate work product and demonstrate good follow up and follow through. Drives change and innovation by improving work product or process, and challenges established norms where appropriate. Proven ability to build supportive and constructive relationships within and outside of the organization; takes the lead in inspiring others to work together for mutual benefit. Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time effectively while also ensuring accuracy of work through attention to detail. Operates ethically: admits mistakes, treats others with respect, trust, and dignity, demonstrates honest and ethical behavior, and follows through on commitments and agreements. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Ideal candidates will have at least a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, and 4-6 years of relevant professional experience. Distribution Center and Warehouse experience is not a requirement.Hachette Book Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Application and production support
job_description: About BNP Paribas Group:BNP Paribas is a top-ranking bank in Europe with an international profile. It operates in 71 countries and has almost 199 000 employees. The Group ranks highly in its three core areas of activity: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail banking networks and financial services are grouped together under Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, centred on corporate and institutional clients. The Group helps all of its clients (retail, associations, businesses, SMEs, large corporates and institutional) to implement their projects by providing them with services in financing, investment, savings and protection. In its Corporate & Institutional Banking and International Financial Services activities, BNP Paribas enjoys leading positions in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas and has a solid and fast-growing network in the Asia/Pacific region.About BNP Paribas India Solutions:Established in 2005, BNP Paribas India Solutions is a wholly owned subsidiary of BNP Paribas SA, a leading bank in Europe with an international reach. With delivery centers located in Bengaluru, Chennai and Mumbai, we are a 24x7 global delivery center. India Solutions services three business lines: Corporate and Institutional Banking, Investment Solutions and Retail Banking for BNP Paribas across the Group. Driving innovation and growth, we are harnessing the potential of over 6000 employees, to provide support and develop best-in-class solutions.About Businessline/Function :Madrid BI – Support Analyst – Job DescriptionTo ensure a stable and resilient production environment for the business, the team is looking for candidates responsible for L1 and L2 production support activities for a BI application.Shift working to support application which is implemented in UK Region: Shift timings: 1:30 PM to 10 PM. (Candidate should be flexible) Flexibility to support the application outside business hours or bank holidays for activities like DR drill, major incidents support or releases, sanity checks etc., if required.Job Title:Support AnalystDate:1st January 2024Department:ITGLocation:MumbaiBusiness Line / Function:Reports to:(Direct)NAGrade:(if applicable)(Functional)Number of Direct Reports:Directorship / Registration:NAPosition PurposeTo ensure a stable and resilient production environment for the business, the team will be responsible for L1 and L2 production support activities for a BI application.ResponsibilitiesDirect Responsibilities Provide L1 & L2 production support activities to a BI application. Response to incidents, user request, problems, in a timely manner Perform daily health check and actively monitor the system Should have good knowledge on SQL, SSIS and SSAS. Contribute majorly the investigation of SSIS packages and tracking the SSIS job execution logs is a must since all the jobs are setup in SSIS. From Cube point of view, understanding of SSAS is required in case if SSIS is completed but data is not loaded in the cube. Communicate and provide status updates on issues to users and application team To liaise with the related parties (e.g. IT, Operations, Front Office) to resolve the incident in a timely and permanent manner Support change management process and releases deployment, align to Group standard and policy Participate in Disaster Recovery test and Business Continuity activitiesContributing Responsibilities Work closely with the application team on new initiatives (e.g. application rollout to new location, capacity planning, architecture) To identify the project priority/ constraint for the project plan related to production activity. Additionally, the Financial Analyst will contribute to process improvement initiatives and support ad-hoc financial analysis projects as needed.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (Other duties may be assigned and are not limited to the following) Analyze financial data and trends to provide insights and recommendations for improving financialperformance. Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, including variance analysis and commentary on key drivers of performance.  Assist in the development of annual budgets and periodic forecasts, working closely with department heads to ensure alignment with strategic objectives.  Develop and maintain financial models to support business planning and decision-making processes.  Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business performance against targets and identify areas for improvement.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant data and information for financial analysis andreporting. Support process improvement initiatives to streamline financial reporting processes and enhance efficiency.  Assist in ad-hoc financial analysis projects as assigned by the Finance Manager or senior management.  Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in financial analysis and reporting, recommending enhancements to existing processes as appropriate. Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in financial analysis or related field, preferably in a corporate finance orFP&A role. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial analysis tools; experience with ERP systems; Inforpreferred. Strong ethical practices and composure under pressure, maintaining integrity and professionalism inchallenging situations. title: Senior Data Analyst
job_description: Job TypeFull-timeDescriptionMerchants Bank of Indiana is expanding its IT business insights/analytics team. We are looking for a Data Analyst who can help support both Merchant Capital and Merchants Bank of Indiana’s teams by developing customized dashboards and operational data extracts. Day-to-day you will gather data from a hosted SQL database to support our key business unit functions and collaborate with the Project Delivery Office and its Product Owners on projects. As we shift from phase one of mostly working with projects where data is requested, gathered, and then reported on. Phase two will be integrating, streamlining, and visualizing our findings, taking that data, and turning it into business insights. We are maturing these processes and looking for a data analyst who wants to be part of building something. If this sounds exciting, apply TODAY!After one year as our Data Analyst, you will know you were successful if you…Establish subject matter experience on the underlying data of critical business applications. Develop and maintain comprehensive reports and Power BI dashboards to drive business decisions by compiling and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data. Collaborate with the Product Owner and Product team members to communicate the value and outcomes of data collection and report findings. Maintain database backups and internal SSRS/Microsoft Fabric environments. Create and maintain technical documentation within the team backlog for ad-hoc requests, reports, data extracts, and applications for future use and audit purposes. Identify and recommend appropriate continuous improvement opportunities. Operate within and champion the Agile/Scrum delivery approach. RequirementsWhat we are looking for…Associate or bachelor’s degree (in computer science or comparable field) required. 2 plus years’ Experience operating in an agile environment with Product Owners, and team members to develop data-driven solutions for business partners, primarily using Microsoft SQL, SQL Reporting Services. Use of statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction. 2 plus years’ experience developing dashboards and other modern data visualizations leveraging Power BI or comparable technology. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications with advanced Excel level ability. Manage multiple tasks with ability to adapt quickly and with managers support be able to adjust to changing priorities and deal with ambiguity. Ability to comprehend, analyze, and systematically compile technical and statistical information into comprehensive reports or other formats. PreferredKnowledge and experience with Middleware or comparable Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) solutions, as well as more modern data integration approaches. Previous experience with Redgate tools a plus but can be taught. Experience with Python, Java, or similar language. Ranked as the top-performing U.S. public bank by S&P Global Market Intelligence, Merchants Bancorp is a diversified bank holding company headquartered in Carmel, Indiana, operating multiple lines of business, including multifamily housing and healthcare facility financing and servicing, mortgage warehouse financing, retail, and correspondent residential mortgage banking, agricultural lending, and traditional community banking. Merchants Bancorp conducts its business through its direct and indirect subsidiaries, Merchants Bank of Indiana, Merchants Capital Corp., and Merchants Mortgage, a division of Merchants Bank of Indiana.

title: Senior Analyst - Accounting
job_description: Position SummaryThis position is responsible for supporting the overall objectives of the Corporate Finance department by compiling and analyzing financial transactions and operational data to provide accurate, timely and relevant information for reporting, performance management and decision support.Position Duties/ResponsibilitiesPrimary Responsibilities:Assimilate data from multiple internal operating systems utilizing various technology platforms to analyze trends and provide decision support to the business units and corporate functions. Assist with the implementation of new technology, automation and processes to improve productivity and reduce risk. Communicate timely with appropriate levels of management to address potential issues and identify areas that may require heightened attention. title: Senior Analyst, QA
job_description: We're hiring for a Senior Analyst, QA to support the investigations team in Bloomington, Indiana!Catalent is a global, high-growth, public company, and a leading partner for the pharmaceutical industry in the development and manufacturing of new treatments for patients worldwide. Your talents, ideas, and passion are essential to our mission: to help people live better, healthier lives. Catalent is committed to a Patient First culture through excellence in quality and compliance, and to the safety of every patient, consumer, and Catalent employee.Catalent Biologics in Bloomington, Indiana is a state-of-the art, GMP manufacturing facility, providing one million sq/ft of drug substance manufacturing, drug product manufacturing, and related pharmaceutical services. This award-winning facility helps customers accelerate biologic drug development programs and bring better treatments to help patients live better, healthier lives.A Senior Analyst, QA  is responsible for investigating and reporting on major and critical deviations to the manufacturing process, customer complaints on finished product, and other manufacturing problems as assigned. This person will interact with multiple departments to understand a problem, identify root cause(s), and assist in identifying appropriate corrective and/or preventive actions (CAPA) to prevent reoccurrence. The Investigator assists Operations and Quality Assurance teams to determine the disposition of non-conforming in-process product and determines if a field alert or recall is required for product that has been released. This is a full-time, salaried position and is 100% site based. The schedule is Monday – Friday, 1st shift.The RolePulls together and leads, as appropriate, multi-function teams to trouble shoot, identify root cause(s) and inform on the Corrective and Preventative measure for all deviations.Reviews the initial triage and RPN score of each assigned deviation investigation to ensure it aligns with the company standard and is appropriately classified.Works with the Quality unit to address any discrepancies or concerns with the classification. Required, as appropriate, to seek out and identify, on location, the processes, equipment and any other areas where a problem related event occurred to view and understand first-hand what happened or could happen. Works with the team to clearly identify and communicate the problem statement that can focus the investigation.Effectively work with a team of SME’s to quickly identify the potential scope of an issue and as required escalate to Leadership to ensure proper actions with customers and regulatory agencies, as required, are properly made and managed. Conduct interviews in a logical and information seeking way to help uncover issues and understand the. Identifies first, all possible corrective and preventative measures through the use of engineering solutions and only moves to administrative controls after the cost/benefit and compliance risk are understood and addressed. Completes all investigation information into a comprehensive deviation report in a manner that clearly defines the problem, the facts and evidence (including circumstantial) that drives a strong root cause conclusion, where possible and is linked to clear and actionable CAPA. Other duties as assigned.The CandidateBachelor’s degree in a STEM discipline.Master’s degree or higher preferred.5-8 years of pharmaceutical manufacturing experience, or related.2 years of GMP experience, or similar regulated industry, required.Why you should join Catalent:Defined career path and annual performance review and feedback process.Medical, dental and vision benefits effective on first day of employment.Potential for career growth on an expanding team and organization.152 hours of paid time off annually plus 8 paid holidays.Community engagement and green initiatives.Competitive salary with bonus potential.Tuition reimbursement program.Diverse, inclusive culture.Generous 401K match.Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career! Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference.Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veterans.If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Catalent Pharma Solutions (Catalent) is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Catalent. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.Important Security Notice to U.S. Job Seekers:Catalent NEVER asks candidates to provide any type of payment, bank details, photocopies of identification, social security number or other highly sensitive personal information during the offer process, and we NEVER do so via email or social media. If you receive any such request, DO NOT respond— it is a fraudulent request. Please forward such requests to spam@catalent.com for us to investigate with local authorities.California Job Seekers can find our California Job Applicant Notice HERE.
