title: IS Analyst
job_description: Job Title: IS AnalystCompany: Aisin World Corp of AmericaDepartment: DX / Infrastructure & SecurityLocation: Seymour, INPosition ResponsibilitiesThe incumbent is expected to perform the following functions that the company has determined are essential to this position:Adhere to company IT processes and securityContribute to the creation and maintenance of End User Services (EUS) related (e.g. Process, Policy, etc.) documentation.Perform tasks according to existing endpoint support related documentation.Perform tasks according to existing client related process documentation.Perform tasks related to maintaining endpoint applications (e.g. Anti-virus, Word, Excel, etc.)Provide desktop/desk side support in line with business applications and processes.Troubleshoot and resolve endpoint issues up to and including data-link layer of the OSI model.Troubleshoot and resolve printer issues for end users.Troubleshoot and escalate user endpoint issues to the IS Analyst III when necessary.Ensure appropriate Endpoint configuration backups occur as required.Build desktop and mobile devices according to company requirements using existing tools, images, etc.Provide technology support for conferencing tools and ensure the ready availability of meeting room resources such as presentation software and audiovisual systems.Assist with hardware and software inventory tasks.Other tasks and duties as assigned.Required Skills and AbilitiesEssential Skills and Experience:Ability to effectively support Windows 10\11 OS, Office 365 apps, Lenovo PCs, and Apple iPhones.User and computer object MACDs in Active Directory and O365 TenantBasic knowledge of IT infrastructure.Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office 365, endpoint technologies & related end user productivity tools.Effective problem solving and quick resolution of Endpoint issues.Self-starter who can execute tasks with minimal oversight.Well-organized and able to prioritize tasks, projects, etc. to maintain a high productivity level.Ability to interact with users directly and participate in problem solving discussions.Ability to review and execute instructions from complex technical documents.Beneficial Skills and ExperienceHelp Desk operations and ticket management. InvGate Help Desk Application knowledge is a plus.Basic knowledge of networking, WAN, server, etc. components a plus.Knowledge of automotive manufacturing IT equipment (e.g. Scan guns) a plusEducation/Training/CertificationsBachelor's degree in IT related field is desired. Equivalent experience will be considered.At least one relevant technology (e.g. Microsoft, ITIL, CompTIA+, etc.) specific certifications desired.Travel RequirementsApproximately 5 %Must be willing and available to travel to such locations and with such frequency as is necessary and desirable to meet business needs.Work Environment RequirementsWith reasonable accommodation:Must be able to operate a personal computer, telephone, and other office equipment.Must perform job duties onsite, when necessary, except those duties that are customarily or by their nature performed offsite (for example, offsite customer visits).Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.Must be able to work on multiple assignments at once, and complete assignments within deadline and budget (if applicable) with satisfactory quality.Must be able to operate as an effective team member.Must be committed to a high standard of safety and be willing and able to comply with all safety laws and all company safety policies.Attendance/Work Hour RequirementsMust maintain an acceptable attendance record.Must be willing and available to work weekends and holidays as necessary and desirable to meet business needs.

title: Senior Forecast Model Analyst (I-II)
job_description: Position Location: Carmel, IN; Eagan, MN; or Little Rock, ARAre you specialized in energy (load, wind, and/or solar generation, uncertainty) forecasting using artificial neural network (ANN), machine learning, and/or regression forecasting techniques? Are you committed to joining the RTO and tackling the load forecasting challenges, whether that is rooftop solar distributed across 15 states of the US, the electrification of transportation, data centers, etc., or the increasing extreme weather events? Would you like to join a high-performing team with diverse expertise in data science, meteorology, engineering, market and grid operations to transform traditional deterministic forecasting and grid operations into a dynamic and probabilistic way? If so, read on…We are searching for a Senior Forecast Model Analyst who will be an integral part of transforming MISO’s load forecasting models to manage increasing behind-the-meter solar, data centers, and changing weather patterns. This role will apply data science, statistics, advanced mathematics, and simulation to enhance load forecasting models, recognize patterns, and quantify uncertainty.As our Senior Forecast Model Analyst, you will focus on load forecasting model enhancement equipped with advanced technologies, including Azure data platform, Machine Learning Studio , ITRON software, etc. You will have ample opportunities to collaborate across MISO, with industry and research entities, and directly help Control Room Operators to drive reliable and efficient operation decisions and market outcomes.Also, our Senior Forecast Model Analyst will work on a high-performing team that is at the center of MISO’s Reliability Imperative. The team has a clear vision and is driving innovative industry developments. The team’s Uncertainty Platform project recently received a $3 million DoE grant and is featured in Bloomberg news. The team is proud of the value they add when delivering reliability especially during extreme weather events, while enjoying a great work-life balance when system conditions allow.In one year, you will know you’re successful if you are: Developing and enhancing load forecasting models (e.g., temperature swings, non-confirmable load, or behind-the-meter solar ) using statistical, algorithmic, data science, and other techniques.  Tracking load forecasting performance or metrics to recognize patterns, address uncertainty, and recommend improvements.  Able to work with control room operations and other areas to provide forecasts and risk assessments.  Current with MISO Reliability Imperative and Future portfolio and familiar with MISO forecasting software and processes .  Collaborating well with the team on projects under Uncertainty Management and Improve Forecasting. We are looking for hardworking candidates who have at least a bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, or a related field, along with at least four years of experience in the energy field.While not required, it would be advantageous if you have any of the following: Master’s degree and/or above.  Experience in RTO or utility load or renewable forecasting or equivalent.  Experience applying statistical methods, computer applications (e.g., Python, SQL), and tools in forecasting and analysis roles. The appropriate level will be determined based upon experience and knowledge.If you're ready to make a significant impact in shaping the future of energy while fostering team growth and innovation, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. Through use of groundbreaking research and advanced technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 45 million Americans. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future – it’s what our immensely talented and dedicated team does every day.MISO in 90 Seconds - YouTube

title: Quality Assurance Analyst I
job_description: SummaryThe Quality Assurance Analyst I is a self-motivated individual working with like-minded teammates responsible for ensuring measurable improvement of software product quality through the execution of effective and efficient quality assurance management and testing processes. Working with the Quality Assurance Project Team Lead and under the guidance of Manager of Quality Assurance, the Quality Assurance Analyst I partners with other Quality Assurance team members and development teams to manage progress against the release commitments and collectively adjust the release plans to ensure effective completion of commitments.  Responsibilities·       Executes testing procedures to ensure that software meets established quality standards.·       Prepares data sets to test logic, error handling and system workflows.·       Isolates, reproduces, and tracks defects. ·       Verifies fixes. ·       Documents testing according to required procedures.·       Familiar with software development cycle and quality assurance methodologies.·       May assist with the creation of new testing scripts and plans.·       Works on projects/matters of limited complexity in a support role. Skills & Personality Traits·       Readily adapts to changing priorities.·       Ability to communicate complex concepts in a clear manner.·       Strong critical thinking skills.·       Excellent organization and time management skills; motivated by hitting deadlines in the face of competing demands.·       Motivated by and passionate about client satisfaction.·       Must have excellent troubleshooting skills.·       Ability to juggle multiple and competing priorities and multitask effectively and without getting rattled.·       Must be able to maintain a positive attitude and professional demeanor in stressful situations.·       Able to quickly adjust to new situations, learn from experiences and apply that learning in various contexts.  Education and Experience Requirements·       Requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.·       Requires up to 4 years of work experience.·       Experience with Financial Services software applications is preferred.﻿We are interested in every qualified candidate who is lawfully eligible to work in the United States. However, we are unable to sponsor visas.

title: JSF Accounting Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionAccounting Analyst - JSFIndianapolis, INThe JSF Accounting Analyst will be responsible for handling all aspects of billing, reconciling and submission of entries to the NAFSC. This role will support the budgeting, forecasting, and month end closing processes for the program. The JSF Accounting Analyst will be an integral part of JSF program team by providing monthly financial variance analysis, identifying opportunities and hazards, and supporting initiatives to improve the performance of the business and finance function. The Accounting Analyst will also monitor purchase orders, including preparation of sub-contract tables, submission of PO changes, as well as variance to spend.Dream Big and Make an ImpactIn this exciting opportunity you will support the budgeting, forecasting, and month end closing processes for the programAt Rolls-Royce, we pioneer cutting-edge technologies that deliver the cleanest, safest and most competitive solutions to our planet’s vital power needs. We embrace the power of data and technology and aim to be Digital First in everything we do.To ensure we continue to be pioneers of our industry, Rolls-Royce has a team of over 16,500 engineers around the globe. They include everyone from world experts in their field to those who manage hundreds of people and millions of dollars worth of investments. We recruit engineers at all levels and in a range of disciplines. title: IT Application Analyst Senior - SC & Finance
job_description: DescriptionWe are looking for a talented IT Application Analyst Senior - SC & Finance to join our team for our Accelera Business Unit in Columbus, IN. Solution Functional Fit Analysis - Composes and decomposes a system into its component parts using procedures, tools and work aides for the purpose of studying how well the component parts were designed, purchased and configured to interact holistically to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements. Technical solution design & development - Translate functional design to technical specs., Define & Document - solution options/testing, develop new solutions - integrations/reports etc. (Projects/Enhancements/Break-Fixes)20% - IT Support / Root Cause Analysis/Documentation10% - Stakeholder, Task Management & coordination for execution (Business, Internal IT/global teams/ IT vendors)10% - Supporting other IT processes (Management Reporting/Planning/Strategy)CompensationSalary Range: $86,400 - $129,600. job_description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategoryFinanceJob DetailsAbout SalesforceWe’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. title: Senior Finance & Regulatory Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionSupport the end-to-end preparation and development of financial & analysis, periodic financial reporting for internal & external process stakeholders, finance & regulatory compliance reporting requirements supporting operational business partners in finance & rate/regulatory matters. Support the completion of exhibits, work papers, interrogatories, and writing testimony to sponsor in support of regulatory and financial strategic plan. Prepare regulatory reports, financial information, and operational data necessary for filing complete and timely rate applications and reports to state regulatory commissions.Generally, serve as first level resource for various department or functional issues which may be related to customer service, billing, tariff administration, financial reporting & compliance, regulatory reporting & compliance, etc. Answer routine financial, rate & regulatory inquiries and assist in recognizing and troubleshooting larger financial or regulatory challenges.Regulatory Functions:Manage regulatory tariff management & update efforts related to regulatory filings ensuring:Timely and accurate maintenance of all rates, rules and regulations related tariff pages. Communication of updated tariffs to the appropriate functional areas and verify correct rates are input into the customer billing system. Prepare analysis that supports operational business partners in the filing of base rate cases and alternative regulatory mechanisms (TDSIC, GCA, trackers, etc.). Ensure the financial support is complete, accurate and timely, meeting all filing deadlines. Support the end-to-end preparation and development of the proforma adjustments that are utilized to support regulatory case filings and alternative regulatory mechanisms. Assist in the end-to-end preparation and implementation of acquisition proceedings, including rate calculations, rate impact analysis, escalation of potential issues as necessary. Financial Functions:Serve as first level resource for analyzing various department or functional operational trends which may entail detailed financial analysis including:Preparation and delivery of annual budgets and expense forecasts. Preparation and delivery of cash flow forecasts. Capital project cost reporting and analysis. Capital budget expenditure analysis. Knowledge/SkillsKnowledge of economic principles relating to utility rates and cost analysis. Knowledge of fundamental accounting concepts and US GAAP accounting practices. Knowledge and understanding of basic analytical concepts for financial analysis. Knowledge and understanding of the methodologies and practices of data collection, research methodologies and of statistical and cost analysis. Prior experience with execution and analysis using company business technologies and computer simulation programs to analyze data in support of financial decision making. Microsoft Office Suite (MS Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) with advanced expertise in Microsoft Excel. Successful candidate must have the ability to review data and make appropriate decisions regarding public utility operations including projection of expenses and revenues. Knowledge and experience in the regulatory/rate case process with direct involvement providing support and/or detailed schedules/analysis in the context of regulatory/rate cases. Experience/EducationSeven to ten years of pertinent financial experience. utility industry a plus. Bachelor's degree (Required) in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business or a closely related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Company DescriptionOhio Valley Gas is a regulated Natural Gas Utility based in Winchester, IN with offices in Connersville, Morristown, Milan, Portland, Sullivan, Tell City and Winchester.Ohio Valley Gas is a regulated Natural Gas Utility based in Winchester, IN with offices in Connersville, Morristown, Milan, Portland, Sullivan, Tell City and Winchester.

title: Senior/Principal Application Support Analyst
job_description: Location: Carmel, IndianaDo you enjoy supporting critical applications, solving sophisticated problems, and helping others resolve complex issues while also providing a great customer experience? Are you excited about the opportunity to join a company that impacts over 45 million people by ensuring the reliability of the electric grid? If so, read on!MISO is hiring a Senior/Principal Application Support Analyst. You will support critical applications that allow MISO members in Central North America and our Control Room Operators dispatch generation that provides stability to the bulk electric system from Canada to the Gulf of Mexico, and from Ohio to Texas.As our Senior/Principal Application Support Analyst, you will be part of a close-knit team of curious, inquisitive, and self-motivated individuals. Lead projects to ensure systems, applications and processes are developed and implemented according to specifications and customer needs. You’ll be part of an on-call monthly rotation, and you’ll also be engaged in maintenance, upgrades, and improvements for various applications. Empower yourself to use your skills to your fullest potential that include:Leading projects that involve maintaining and upgrading complex systemsExecuting application troubleshooting and taking action to correct problems encounteredCollaborating with vendors to conceptualize, initiate, and develop software programs and applications that align with our business requirementsTesting, debugging, documenting, and installing modified and new programs to meet business and compliance requirementsUsing your critical and intuitive thinking to analyze high-risk situations, generate multiple options and approaches while considering how the solution may change or impact the organization Proactively detecting issues before incidents happenTo be successful in the role, we’ll be seeking the following attributes:Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (or 8+ years relevant work experience equivalency)Experience developing and coordinating project plansSupporting highly available, mission critical applications and being part of a 24x7 on-call rotation Using Oracle or similar experience with databasesNavigating in Windows and/or Linux systemsPrevious energy industry experience is a huge plus!Appropriate level will be determined based upon experience and knowledge.Dynamic innovation is happening in the electric industry, from digitalizing homes and distributed resources to renewable energy and a constantly evolving grid. MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. and through use of groundbreaking research and sophisticated technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 45 million Americans. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future – it’s what our immensely hardworking and dedicated team does every day.We are proud to offer #workfromhome options to our employees, and MISO offers a comprehensive benefits package available on your first day of employment.#DiscoverMISO #MISOCareers  #WeareMISOMISO in 90 Seconds

title: Kodiak Billing & Collections Analyst
job_description: Your Journey at Crowe Starts Here:At Crowe, you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to today’s complex business issues. Crowe’s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth expertise and understanding of sophisticated process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their commitment to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value. Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our commitment to internal career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a “Best Place to Work.” We are 75 years strong and still growing. Come grow with us!Job Description:Crowe Healthcare Consulting is now Kodiak Solutions!This role is with Kodiak Solutions, Crowe’s Healthcare Consulting business that is now its own standalone company. Read more about the Healthcare practice’s impressive story and Kodiak below! At Kodiak you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to today’s complex business issues facing the Healthcare industry. Kodiak personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth Healthcare expertise and application of data and technology to simplify the business of Healthcare for thousands of hospitals nationwide.Description of Role:Operations Analyst is within the Kodiak Solutions Revenue Cycle group. This position requires a strong understanding of billing processes as well as business processes and operations. The Operations Analyst would mainly assist and/or be responsible for billing and collections including invoice preparation, generation, review, coordination, follow up as well as maintenance and updating of documents and reports. He/She should be detail-oriented, organized, a problem solver who can work with stakeholders at multiple levels in the organization to understand business practices as well as project goals and objectives, and determine the best approach for task completion. The ability to work independently, an analytical mindset and a solutions focus are critical, along with strength in working with numbers. The Operations Analyst may be asked to perform other duties as needs arise, including project management, contract management, and resource management.Business Case:The role is to assist with Revenue Cycle operations support activities that historically have been owned by client service personnel and/or to alleviate tasks from the LOB Operations role. The volume of reporting and operational tasks has grown to an (analyst level) and we need to offload this work from important resources' plates. These activities include: mainly billing and collections as well as quality assurance, contracting, project management, budgeting, sales administration, financial metrics and reporting, follow ups, etc.Pipeline:This ongoing body of work will continue to grow going forward as the need for invoicing, financial metrics, and reporting is not slowing down. This resource may be able to streamline various activities as assigned and create bandwidth to perform additional duties such as provide assistance to the finance and people operations team.About Kodiak SolutionsThis is an exciting time to join our growing Kodiak Solutions team! Recently, Crowe LLP reached a decision to divest its Crowe Healthcare Consulting practice, now Kodiak, in a sale to TPG, a global asset management firm that will be the perfect partner to take Kodiak to the next level. The story around Kodiak is an impressive one. Derek Bang, the practice founder and inventor of the group’s flagship software product for net revenue reporting, Revenue Cycle Analytics (RCA) came to Crowe nearly 20 years ago with an idea for a strategic pursuit in the Healthcare Industry through his previous experience as a Healthcare Auditor at a Big 4 firm. Crowe invested in the idea, providing the resources and support necessary to launch the RCA product and organically grow the practice to its current state, now offering a broad suite of software and services that help healthcare CFOs solve challenges across financial reporting, revenue cycle, and risk and compliance. Kodiak currently services more than 1,800 hospitals and 200,000 practice-based physicians across all 50 states. Due to the unique complexities of the business such as technology and data security, it is time for a new partner with the appropriate expertise and resources to invest in the future growth of Kodiak. The transaction will enable Kodiak to operate with greater flexibility and focus, positioning it to accelerate growth and expand its technology portfolio to better serve healthcare provider organizations across the county.Our Benefits:At Crowe, we know that great people are what makes a great firm. We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you!How You Can Grow:We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and aspirations. Learn more about where talent can prosper!More about Crowe:Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.Crowe LLP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.Crowe LLP does not accept unsolicited candidates, referrals or resumes from any staffing agency, recruiting service, sourcing entity or any other third-party paid service at any time. Any referrals, resumes or candidates submitted to Crowe, or any employee or owner of Crowe without a pre-existing agreement signed by both parties covering the submission will be considered the property of Crowe, and free of charge.

You can learn more about our global Inclusion strategy here.Hybrid working is a way in which our people can balance their time between the office, home or another remote location. It’s a locally managed and flexed informal discretionary arrangement. As a minimum we’re all expected to attend the workplace for collaboration and other specific reasons, on average three days per week.Relocation assistance will be provided if applicable.Close DateMay 2nd 2024Job CategoryFinanceJob Posting Date24 Apr 2024; 00:04Pay Range$50,918 - $76,378-AnnuallyLocation:Indianapolis, INBenefitsRolls-Royce provides a comprehensive and competitive Total Rewards package that includes base pay and a discretionary bonus plan. Eligible employees may have the opportunity to enroll in other benefits, including health, dental, vision, disability, life and accidental death & dismemberment insurance; a flexible spending account; a health savings account; a 401(k) retirement savings plan with a company match; Employee Assistance Program; Paid Time Off; certain paid holidays; paid parental and family care leave; tuition reimbursement; and a long-term incentive plan. The options available to an employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as date of hire, employment type, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

title: Application Support Analyst
job_description: Location: Carmel, IndianaAre you passionate about tackling complex issues, providing support for applications, and assisting customers in resolving problems to ensure a positive customer experience? Does the prospect of continual learning and responding to new challenges excite you? If so, read on!As our Application Support Analyst, you will join a tight-knit team of curious, inquisitive, and self-motivated individuals. You’ll have a sense of value because what you do affects how MISO keeps the lights on for millions of people! As a vital member this team, you’ll collaborate closely with a dynamic team, contributing to maintenance, upgrades, and enhancements across various applications. Empower yourself to use your skills to your fullest potential that include:Executing application troubleshooting and take independent action to correct problems encounteredTesting, debugging, documenting, and installing modified and new programs to meet business and compliance requirementsUsing your critical and intuitive thinking to analyze moderately high-risk situations, generate multiple options and approaches while considering how the solution may change or impact the organizationProactively detecting issues before incidents happenTo be successful as an Application Support Analyst, we’ll be seeking the following attributes:Bachelor’s degree in technical field (or 4 years relevant work experience equivalency)Using Oracle or similar experience with databasesNavigating in Windows and/or Linux systemsSupporting critical applications and experience troubleshooting, triagingBeing part of a 24x7 on-call rotationPrevious energy industry experience is a huge plus!Appropriate level will be determined based upon experience and knowledge.Dynamic innovation is happening in the electric industry, from digitalizing homes and distributed resources to renewable energy and a constantly evolving grid. MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. and through use of groundbreaking research and sophisticated technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 45 million Americans. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future – it’s what our immensely hardworking and dedicated team does every day.We are proud to offer #workfromhome options to our employees, and MISO offers a comprehensive benefits package available on your first day of employment.#DiscoverMISO #MISOCareers #WeareMISO

title: Channel Sales Manager
job_description: Position Description:The Channel Manager will oversee all Channel Programs with responsibility to develop, execute, maintain, and monitor associated activities. The Channel Manager will be responsible for developing our strategies and executing programs to increase brand awareness, mindshare, and demand generation for full solution of products with our Distributor Partners, System Integrators, and other partners. The ideal candidate will be able to effectively lead cross-functional teams made up of Sales, Marketing, Finance, and others to execute all programs. A strong drive, solid communication skills and ability to work well in teams is critical to this role. Channel Manager Responsibilities include:Own and drive the Channel Program to deliver profitable revenue growth and mindshare.Develop annual revenue targets and goals Manage annual and quarterly business reviews with partners and key stakeholders.Develop joint strategic action plans with key partners and follow through to completion in collaboration with sales team.Compile and communicate monthly scorecards to partners and provide finance with data for rebate accruals (working with financial analyst to obtain/review data).Drive new product launch promotion and activities with distribution partners.Drive new product additions/introductions with MRO distributors to expand products they market and offer.Collaborate with Channel Sales Team to execute marketing campaigns, develop sales enablement tools and grow business with key partners.Engage with marketing contacts and leadership at partners to develop messaging, marketing collateral, tools and programs to help drive product sales and mindshare.Conduct on-site visits to partners as needed to understand their business and needsManage the Partner Portal content and functionality through collaboration with sales, marketing, IT, and finance teamsDevelop additional programs/promotions to drive revenue through our partnersAssist with continuous improvement/development of our Channel Programs including communications, collateral, content development, and sales enablement.Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Product and Finance teams. Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree preferred.5+years of experience with partner/distributor/channel management.Process driven. Demonstrates professional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.Experience with managing budgets and sales analysis.Experience in strategic planning and execution of action plans.Industrial automation industry experience preferred.Effective at motivating teams to produce quality materials within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several projects.Active participation and facilitation of group meetings.Possess robust leadership skills and abilities, excellent communication skills with all levels of employees/management, and maintain strong planning, organization, and follow up. Must have working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, and MS Outlook. Must be able to perform multiple tasks and be very detail oriented.
Industries: Automation Machinery Manufacturing, Manufacturing, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing

title: Concepteur Technico Fonctionnel h/f
job_description: MissionInetum Chauray recherche un Business Analyst Technico fonctionnel h/f pour intégrer la Digital factory de notre client sur Niort.En tant que BA, vous serez responsable de la liaison entre les équipes techniques et fonctionnelles pour assurer la livraison de solutions optimales répondant aux besoins de l'entreprise.Vos responsabilités sur cette mission serontL'analyse et la compréhension des besoins métier et les traduire en exigences fonctionnelles et techniques.Vous collaborerez avec les équipes de développement pour concevoir des solutions qui répondent aux exigences métier.(Java/React/Springboot).Votre participation à la planification des sprints et à la définition des back logs produits est exigée.ProfilCompétences RequisesUne expérience en tant que Business Analyst dans un environnement tech est demandé.Connaissance des méthodologies Agile et expérience de travail dans un environnement Agile.Capacité à traduire les besoins métier en exigences techniques.Excellentes compétences en communication et en gestion des parties prenantes.Expérience du modèle Agile Spotify serait un plus.Connaissance du langage Java.Connaissance de l'automatisation des tests et de Postman.Requêtage de jeux de données et connaissance de Oracle ou My sql.Ce Que Nous ProposonsEnvironnement de travail innovant et dynamique.Opportunités de développement de carrière.Package de rémunération attractif.Fourchette de salaire selon votre niveau d'expertise.OrganisationInetum est un leader européen des services numériques. Pour les entreprises, les acteurs publics et la société dans son ensemble, les 28 000 consultants et spécialistes du groupe visent chaque jour l'impact digital : des solutions qui contribuent à la performance, à l'innovation et au bien commun.Présent dans 19 pays au plus près des territoires, et avec ses grands partenaires éditeurs de logiciels, Inetum répond aux enjeux de la transformation digitale avec proximité et flexibilité.Porté par son ambition de croissance et d'industrialisation, Inetum a généré en 2023 un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 milliards d'€.Pour répondre à un marché en croissance continue depuis plus de 30ans, Inetum a fait le choix délibéré de se recentrer sur 4 métiers afin de gagner en puissance et proposer des solutions sur mesure, adaptées aux besoins spécifiques de ses clients : le conseil (Inetum Consulting), la gestion des infrastructures et applications à façon (Inetum Technologies), l'implémentation de progiciels (Inetum Solutions) et sa propre activité d'éditeur de logiciels (Inetum Software). Inetum a conclu des partenariats stratégiques avec 4 grands éditeurs mondiaux - Salesforce, ServiceNow, Microsoft et SAP et poursuit une stratégie d'acquisitions dédiée afin d'entrer dans le top 5 européen sur ces technologies et proposer la meilleure expertise à ses clients.Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

title: Network and Infrastructure Systems Analyst
job_description: Position OverviewButler University’s Information Technology department is currently seeking a passionate and skilled Infrastructure Systems Analyst who is eager to join a team that values education, collaboration, innovation, and fun. The Analyst will be involved with Butler’s enterprise infrastructure technology at all levels, including virtualized compute environment, backup and storage systems, wired and wireless networks, and associated applications (including but not limited to Windows Server/Ubuntu, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, ESXI, and VCenter.) Additionally, the Analyst will have the unique opportunity to participate in business ventures as part of a new Butler entity in service to the local community. Alongside this, the Analyst will have the opportunity to obtain a variety of technology certifications including Cisco, Ruckus, Synology, and others. As a member of the Butler IT team, the Analyst will be responsible for designing and implementing robust solutions, managing system configurations, and ensuring seamless integration with emerging technologies. The role requires a hands-on approach to troubleshooting complex issues, optimizing system performance, and staying abreast of industry trends to recommend and implement innovative solutions, in addition to daily operational work (including provisioning, de-provisioning, patching, configuration updates, and remediating security issues). The Analyst will also work with hardware vendors, provide detailed written documentation of support protocols for supported systems, and provide occasional end-user training.  Are you ready to move your career forward? Are you interested in joining a world-class group of technology professionals to support and enhance the teaching and learning of Butler students? If you are motivated by the ideas of equity and academic excellence upon which Butler University was founded, we invite you to consider joining our team where we boldly innovate and enrich the communities around us. This position offers a hybrid work model, combining both in-office and remote responsibilities.  ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable and reliable IT infrastructure solutions. Provide expert-level support for escalated technical issues, serving as a resource for complex problem resolution and root cause analysis. Collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand specific business requirements and translate them into effective IT infrastructure solutions Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides. Participate in capacity planning and performance tuning activities to ensure the scalability of the IT environment Provide ad-hoc end-user training for application systems. Provide and be committed to exceptional customer service and proactively undertake initiatives that improve customer experience. Required Qualifications 3-5 years experience managing/supporting IT infrastructure3-5 years of experience in a full-time technical role Direct experience providing support for enterprise application systems Experience with coding (Python/PowerShell/Bash preferred) as well as an understanding of best practices in task automation Excellent verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail Flexibility in a changing environment Proven experience in analyzing system/business processes to identify inefficiencies and developing strategies for improvement Ability and desire to thrive in a team environment Willingness to work a flexible schedule as needed including occasional evenings, early mornings, and weekends Preferred Qualifications Experience with any of the following: Windows Server Ubuntu and/or Oracle Linux VMware Hypervisor stacks Active Directory Virtualized server and storage systems Network hardware including Ruckus and Cisco Meraki wireless Experience with next-generation firewalls and endpoint protection systems Managing switches, routers, firewall, IPS, Prime, wireless, ISE (NAC) Network/platform-agnostic desktop/BYOD troubleshooting and support experience DNS and DHCP (Windows based preferred) administration Windows/Mac operating systems Experience with cybersecurity and assessment/remediation of identified security risks Experience with data ingest systems including CSV input/output Experience with vendor relationship management Project management/budgeting experience Experience in a higher education and/or a large/complex IT organization Experience with writing, organizing and maintaining technical documentation 4-year degree in a technical field Additionally, qualified candidates should possess the following: Proven customer service and telephone skills; professional appearance and demeanor under pressureDesire to learn and support multiple platforms (Windows, Linux, Apple, etc.) Ability to visualize, articulate, conceptualize and solve problems Experience leading small and mid-sized projects Ability to organize/manage work that is assigned from different sources while balancing shifting priorities Character traits, including the following: trustworthy; exhibits bias for action and avoids analysis paralysis; seeks to understand before being understood; client advocate; and willing to change and try new things BU Benefits and PerksPlease check out Butler’s Total Rewards website to learn more about our benefit offerings, which include:Paid Time Off and Holidays:18 days of paid time off (vacation and PTO days)8 Paid HolidaysPaid Winter Break between Christmas Eve and New Year’s DayPaid Parental Leave (after 1 year of full-time employment)Health:Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans including disability and life insurance programsRetirement:10% employer contribution after 1 year of full-time employmentTuition Assistance:Remission of tuition for classes taken at Butler for employees, spouses, and dependent children.Eligibility after 9 months of full-time employmentEmployees & spouses- undergraduate/graduate degreesDependents (under age 26)- undergraduate degreeCovers tuition onlyTuition Exchange Program for DependentsButler Facilities Access, Discounts and Perks:Access to Butler’s on-site fitness facility and libraries for full-time staff and facultyLinkedIn Learning CoursesFree premium subscription to the Calm AppFree subscription to the WSJ and NYTDiscount at the College BookstoreDiscount on select Athletic and Arts/Events Center PerformancesAbout ButlerButler University is a private, nationally recognized comprehensive university encompassing six colleges: Arts, Business, Communication, Education, Liberal Arts & Sciences, and Pharmacy & Health Sciences. Approximately 4,500 undergraduate and 1,000 graduate and doctoral students are enrolled at Butler, representing 46 states and 24 countries.Join us at the crossroads of tradition & transformation. A career at Butler University means so much more than a job. Join the dedicated, innovative, and supportive community of faculty and staff that is moving Butler Beyond.Butler University is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable environment for all employees. We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of age, gender, gender identity, sex, race, religion, color, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other legally protected category.

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description: DescriptionThe  Product Manager  should operate as a strategic thinker, capable of owning and driving key initiatives for the Global Product organization and their key stakeholders. The role holder will be responsible for executing against the vision and priorities in a collaborative approach working across business, technology, risk, operations and other functions to ensure that product vision, strategy, performance and priorities, roadmaps, capacity/consumption and impacts are clear and understood.  What Are We Looking For in This Role?   Product Managers are responsible for the definition, prioritization, and management of the product backlog and roadmap.  Partner closely with stakeholders to define the strategic direction, vision and roadmap for our product suite.  Collect, organize, and evaluate feedback from stakeholders.  Define requirements, user stories and features, and work with the development teams to estimate and schedule the work.  Employing a variety of techniques to assess stakeholder needs and feedback to help direct roadmaps.  Work with development teams regarding feature prioritization, and/or use case and product requirements, escalating and tracking defect issues through to resolution, regular communication with internal stakeholders of gaps that exist between the existing product and stakeholder expectations.  Product Managers will need to understand business requirements, determine value, translate those into user stories, work with the development teams to translate requirements/stories into actionable development tasks.  Prioritize requested work and provide transparency around execution roadmaps.  Collaborate with product design, product ops, engineering teams and other stakeholders, conduct workshops and discovery to create the bridge between market needs and feature delivery.  Lead execution by an engineering team(s) and work with development teams on feature prioritization, use case and product requirements, and driving and tracking both defect and enhancement development.  Accountable to make and deliver against commitments made to business stakeholders.  This position requires daily attention to processes in place, deadlines and quality standards are met, risks identified and mitigated, and professional communications are maintained on a regular schedule to stakeholders.  The Product Manager bears responsibility to ensure a positive stakeholder engagement experience by delivering a desirable product while taking a vocal leadership role in the product build process.  Facilitate communication amongst project leaders, peers and relevant cross-functional stakeholders to maintain alignment and awareness of product performance and vision  Identify and take ownership of problems in targeted segments through constant engagement with our stakeholders  Work with the Product team to understand end-users product requirements and desired features, work with internal teams to communicate product requirements, and monitor tasks  Take the initiative to recommend process improvements and demonstrate creative thinking  Identify new product enhancements, synergies, etc to drive value for the organization.    What Are Our Desired Skills and Capabilities?    Minimum 1-3 years product management experience.  Experience working on technology products as either a product manager, product owner, or business analyst  Experience managing product performance, driving and supporting other functions to maximize product performance while measuring appropriate metrics and championing success stories.  Proven track record of delivering success while operating within a team environment.  Product management experience with data management and/ or API documentation tools  Take the initiative to recommend process improvements and demonstrate creative thinking  The mindset of a creative problem solver and critical thinker who is able to articulate the problems that we need to be passionate about solving.  A strong focus on collaboration, placing high importance on developing the trust of supporting functions and stakeholders.  Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Prior payments or technology industry experience is preferred but not required.  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience At Global Payments our vision is to be “Champions of Inclusion.” We are fully committed and focused on creating a better tomorrow in the communities in which we live and work. We aspire to ensure fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all team members. We believe all team members should be able to bring their true, authentic selves to the workplace and feel accepted, engaged and understood.
Industries: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting

title: Senior Lead Developer/CE Dynamic365
job_description: Senior Dev lead/CE Dynamic365The Senior Software Engineer is responsible for managing Dynamics 365 CE Field Service, ideal candidate possesses, strong technical expertise in configuring, customizing, and supporting the platform. This role will play a key role with current implementation and further enhancing the application with solutions to meet our organization’s business needs. Key aspect of the role is to work with functional leads and business analyst to gather requirements for translating to technical design and delivery in meeting the business goals.What You Will Do:Drive design, development and deployment of Dynamics 365 Field Service ongoing implementation & enhancementsAnalyze Business Requirements: Collaborate with business analysts and cross function ERP IT teams, following DevOps process to deliver solutionCustomize and configure with business processes, including entities, forms, workflows, and business rules.Develop and deploy custom plugins, workflows, Power Automate Flows and scripts to extend the functionality of Dynamics 365 Field Service.Participate in cross functional design for integrations between Dynamics 365 Field Service and other systems, such as Salesforce, FinOps, and third-party applications.Create and maintain documentation, including technical design specifications, architectural guidelines, and best practices of D365 Field Service applicationStay Up-to-Date with Industry Trends: Continuously stay informed about the latest updates and trends in field service management and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service. Proactively identify opportunities for system optimization and recommend improvementsManage the ongoing support, maintenance, and new features of D365 Field Service application with software updatesWhat You Need to Succeed:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related fieldMinimum of 3-5 years of experience on Dynamics 365 CE platform - CRM or Field Service as Technical analyst/developerKnowledge of configuring and customizing Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM or Field Service and Mobile appProficient with Power Platform – Apps, Automate flow to extend Dynamics 365 CE platformExperience working with or integrating with 3rd party service applications using APIs, web Services and middlewareExperience working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service integrated with FinOps is a plusEnergetic personality who excels in collaboration and teamworkAround10% travel to support workshops and project activities
